review_content: Can, as Kozel Premium Lager 4.6%. Enjoyed straight from the can. Some malt, bitterness and slightly bitter hoppy finish. Decent.

bottiglia 50 cl, 4,6% VOL, schiuma bianca fine media persistenza, colore giallo/oro limpido, al naso cereali leggero agrumi e frutta matura, in bocca pane cerali leggero agrumi e leggero burrosa, corpo leggero, carbonazione moderata, amaro percettibile. Non molto pulita ma si lascia bere. c. Carrefour Germignaga 11.06.21
Bevuta in bottiglia.  Tipica birra bionda comunque buona.  Leggera e buon gusto d'orzo.

[as Kozel Premium Lager (4.6%)] Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso viene attratto dall'orzo. La finezza olfattiva è normale e il modo in cui permane è sufficiente. Il manto birroso superiore è caratterizzato da una schiuma che resiste abbastanza. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di consistenza limpida. Il colore è giallo dorato carico. Il corpo è pieno. L'amaro è di media potenza. La forza gustativa e si prolunga in modo sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di facile beva. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. L'aroma in bocca porta i segni di miele, pane cotto di recente, erbaceo e agrumi.

Bottiglia da 0,50. Schiuma scarsa e volatile. Colore oro. Carbonatura leggermente eccessiva. Aromi di cereali e caramello. Gusto lieve alquanto acidulo. Finale breve. Lager di bassa qualità. Consiglio 4/10

For the price in Australia this is really decent. A little egg in that malt lager aroma but the flavour is quite nice, has some sweet over ripe banana, a syrupy body with some decent bitterness. Golden/dark colour, well matched carbonation. Not a typical refereshing lager fix. This shouldn't be good, but it is.

Lager ceca dal colore giallo dorato, con una schiuma bianca ma poco persistente. Il profumo è bello maltato così come il gusto, amarognolo ma ben bilanciato con i luppoli che donano sfumature dolciastre alla birra. Il corpo è leggero, delicato e rotondo ed è molto beverina, ideale da bere a tavola in particolare accompagnando piatti tipici della cucina ceca. Non male per essere una lager commerciale.

Pours with a medium head from a 500 mL can.
The version I drank came from the Czech brewery at 4.6% alcohol.
Quite bitter for the North American market, but I found it excellent with a hoppy, but not overpowering, aftertaste.

Die Optik gibt sich vielversprechend. Klar und satt goldgelb mit leichtem Einschlag von Bernstein. Die weiße, mittel- bis feinporige Schaumkrone zeigt sich stabil und gut haltbar.
In der Nase würzig malzig und leicht hefig.
Dem leicht herben und malzigen Antrunk folgt ein getreidig malziger, gut würziger und leicht metallischer Mittelteil, in dem sich die erwartete Herbe praktisch gänzlich zurückhält.
Im Abgang kommt eine leicht phenolische Note hervor, die nach mehreren Sekunden einer mäßig guten Hopfenherbe weicht.
Für meinen Geschmack wirkt dieses Bier zu wenig ausgewogen, nicht wirklich rund und zu lieblos.

33cl bottle from italian store, mine for the review is 4.6% abv and made in Italy by Birra Peroni, which i didn't realize at first. Would like to try the other version and know if they are different enough to have 2 different pages from seeing the good ratings, since that's what i believe. Aroma seemed good at first of malt and grassy hops, turned to smell metallic once poured. I mean, too much really. Clear golden color and the little foam didn't last a moment. Taste was better at least but not by much.. too much like water, with some carbonation and the hops bitterness being by far the best thing about it. I'm leaving a minimum score and only because i have hope the other reviews are not about the same Kozel Premium Lager made here... this one was really bad, no joke.

De Combino. En copa hefe de Bavaria. En almuerzo, con tortilla de patatas de Km1, pollo guisado y bombones Nestlé caja roja. Muy refrescante y con buen cuerpo, de las que te entran ganas de acabartela de un trago
500ml bottle. white medium head  aroma malt, grain, grass?Medium sweetness and light to medium bitterness. decent beer
Huvitav, et see on mul hindamata. Muidu olen proovinud nii pudelist kui vaadist. Värskena pole viga, aga üldiselt Urquell on ikka way parem igas olekus.
Eine helle Farbe mit leichter Trübung. Geruch nach süßen Malz. Erfrischender Antrunk. Aromen von Malz und Brot sind deutlich spürbar. Ein sehr steigendes Bier.

Pite jakiś czas temu. Ocena w celu uzupełnienia profilu. 
https://www.instagram.com/czgr_

Farbe: goldgelb
Schaum: verfliegt super schnell
Geruch: malzig, etwas muffig
Geschmack: antrunk malzig süß, am Ende wird es bitter aber nicht zu sehr Abgang ist kurz. Die süße bleibt allerdings süß.
Light amber color, almost no foam. Fresh floral taste, a bit sweet and malty. Very decent, a good representative of Pilsener Beer.

(500ml bottle, 4.6% ABV, says "1874" on the label, Berlin. 21 Oct 2020)
AROMA: soft grain and lager notes, biscuit, boiled vegetables 
APPEARANCE: light brownish honey yellow, clear, ok head, minimal residual 
TASTE: grain, touch of toast, moderate euro lager notes, very lightly sweet, some green and fall notes with wood and nuts, 
PALATE: light to medium, easy astringency,  touch creamy, light bitterness, soft followthru 

OVERALL: a very drinkable euro lager, a bit light and simple, but overall quite enjoyable. This could deserve a bit higher rating... worthy of being part of a blind taste comparison.
Botella 500ml de 4.6% de Plzen.Color dorada con espuma blanca,fina,alta,resistente.Aroma malta,herbal,muy aromatica.Sabor ligero amargor,malta,herbal.Postgusto queda amargo

Velké Popovice Kozel - den Namen muss man sich erst mal auf der deutschen Zunge zergehen lassen. Geruch frisch, floral, leicht süßlich. Geschmacklich findet man Malz, leichte florale Nuancen und deutlich bittere Noten. Das Bier ist wunderbar weich. Sehr süffig, was allerdings bei nur 4,6 % Alk. zu erwarten war. Nicht zu wässrig, schmeckt aber ein bisschen "abgekocht". Trotzdem ganz gut. Bis jetzt waren das Kozel Lager das Beste was ich aus Tschechien hatte.

Can 500ml at Ruovesi. From S-market Ruovesi. BBE 2021-04-16. Pours clear golden with white head.  Flavor has malts, grain, hay, light hops. Medium to light body, watery texture, average carbonation, malty finish.

Pint on draught, at a restaurant. Gold colour + white head. Grainy, light malty, grassy, light rusty metallic, light lactic / milky (?), light dusty / cobwebby (?). Yeah I'm pretty sure this is infected, still honestly tastes better than the other beers they had though (Budweiser + Corona)
Can in Croatia. Standard lager more than anything. Very silky, not overly malted or hopped. Decent but not premium imo
Can. Zlta farba, slaba bena. Vona zelezita, chlebova. Chut trpko horka, zelezita, umela.
Gift from a good friend (her favorite beer), this version of the Premium Lager is at 4.6%, nice to see made from malted barley, yet, the barley taste could be made more present.

Ein Bier das man in letzter Zeit in Österreich immer öfter findet. Da ich ja leider nicht ins Land der Pilsners reisen kann, kaufte ich mir eine NORM-Flasche. 
Ein Blick auf die Rückseite des Etiketts machte mich dann etwas stutzig: "Gebraut in Österreich für Asahi!". Gut - dass Kozel zum Asahi-Konzern gehört, ist bekannt, aber ich wüßte keine Brauerei in Österreich, welche zu Asahi gehört -immerhin hat sich Heineken den größten Anteil der heimischen Brauereien geschluckt. Keine Ahnung, wer hier offenbar in Lizenz braut.
Da ich auch das tschechische Original kenne, will ich mir eine Bewertung zutrauen.
Als ich es das erste Mal trank, hat es mich schwer erfreut.
Jetzt würde ich es als klassischen Industrie-Standard betrachten, das man gut trinken kann, aber nicht wirklich in Erinnerung bleibt.
An average pilsener for a hot afternoon or a party. Some malt sweetness, some hops and some wet paper.

Schaum: gut dicht beständig
Farbe: klares gold.
Nase: kräftiger Bierhopfen, heu, darunter süß
Geschmack: bitter. Feinperlig, aber an der Grenze zu Lack. Ein bisschen farblos. Gerste im Nachgeschmack. Im, aber braucht man nicht
Aroma : Light carmel maltiness with floral hoppy note.   Taste : Light floral note, but nothing too distinct. O.k. for a hot afternoon if just looking for something refreshing

As a Kozel 12% (4,8% ABV) 500ml Bottle from Slovakia (Potraviny Makos) niedaleko malowniczego Bardejova. Nalane do czeskiego kufla wiec piana jest oczywiscie spora i trwala, zlota jasna i klarowna barwa. W smaku slodowe, moze troche mniej goryczkowe niz zapamietana lata temu wersja czeska. Brewed and Bottled in Velky Saris, Slovakia.

As a Kozel Premium (4,8% ABV) 500ml Bottle from Czech Republic (Potraviny u Petra) Many years ago. Piana solidna, wiec nie jestem orginalny piszac to. zlota barwa zapach zateckiej zielonej rosliny w ksztalcie szyszki, chmielna gorycz, trwala tak samo jak i ta piana. Nalane do pokala prazdroja. Ciut inne, moze lepsze od wersji Slowackiej. Brewed and Bottled in Plzen. Czech Republic.
Sporo było wypitego piwa swojego czasu. historyczna opinia i ocena z pamięci.

Golden color. Good foam, polite retention.
Nose. The aroma is malt, slightly hoppy, with notes of caramel.
Taste. Malt in sweetish slightly caramel. Moderate bitterness of medium duration.

Bottled. Clear yellow colour, small, diminishing white head. Malty aromas, some hay notes. Taste is sweetish and a bit metallic, low hop bitterness. Light body, high carbonation, watery mothfeel, metallic aftertaste. Average european lager.
# 261; 3/2016. Nepříliš dobře vyvážený český ležák. Sladová chuť je doplněna drsnější, ulpívající hořkostí a nepříliš dobrou dochutí.
In der Nase Mais, Getreide, im Trunk dann recht flach, süß, Getreide, hinten wässrig, sehr flach und langweilig.

24.09.2019 - 0.5l can from penny in charlottenburg, bb 15.06.2020. pours a clear pale golden with a medium head. aroma of hay and slight cereals. flavour of citrus, apples, hay. slightly bitter finish. correct.

Blind test - 25 koncerniaków.
Wygląd: Barwa złota, klarowna z niską białą pianą, zbudowaną z drobnych i średnich oczek, która szybko redukuje się do małego krążka, nie pozostawiając lacingu. 
Aromat: Diacetyl, mocne utlenienie kartonowe, miodowe oraz lekka słodowość chlebowa i nuta ziołowego chmielu. 
Smak: Tak jak w aromacie. W ustach półsłodkie, treściwość średnioniska z śliskością diacetylową na podniebieniu, wysycenie średnioniskie. Goryczki brak. Finisz wytrawny z nutą słodowości chlebowej, utlenienia i diacetylu.
500 ml bottle. Clear golden, foamy head. Grain, lemon, metallic hops. Metallic bitterness. Medium bodied, watery oily texture, lively carbonated, dry metallic finish.
Light and airy, nice with food. Perhaps a tad too light for my liking. Lacks a bit of richness and weight
Bottle from Edeka - golden, white head. makes a fresh impression, crisp. low sweetness, medium bitter, bit grainy. round and good, though simple.
Golden body with white head. Aroma is malts biscuits. Taste is nearly the same. Aftertaste is nice balanced. Nice Lager

Refreshing, light, easy to drink.
Doesn't have special feature but nothing wrong.
I wanna drink this on hot summer days.

Pretty run of the mill Czech pils, watery, medium to high carbs, plenty of grassy and breads flavour, low bitterness. 

Meh.
Fine chech premium lager. Copper golden color, small white head. Normal bitter.
Golden color with an off-white head that disipated fairly quickly. The malty aroma was toast and light hop pepperiness. The taste is watery.

Pours a golden color with white head. Light malt aroma and taste. Standard light lager. 

Notes: can, Apr ‘19
500 ml can poured at home. Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Smells like grass. Tastes like grass with a little sweetness as well. Not too bad actually.

L:
-pours a clear golden with a small to medium,foamy,grey head
-low to medium carbonation visible
S:
-apple,spicy,grainy,soapy,buttery
T:
-spicy,grassy,mineral,grainy,slightly bready
F:
-medium carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
Barely average Czech Pils.
Amber boja, bijela pjena srednje debljine, trajnija. Aroma trave, blago meda, citrusa i vlažnog papira. Srednje gorčine, kratkog gorkog finiša. Vodeno-uljane teksture, jake karbonizacije.
Butelka 0,5 litra. Barwa złota, klarowna. Wysoka biała piana, o dużej trwałości. Słaba goryczka.
Cerveja muito macia, com sabor, gaseificação bastante acentuada quando entra no copo.
Pitko, odlično, super boje, kratkotrajne bogate pjene. Tipičan lager, za odmoriti i popiti poslije posla...

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Pint from tap at The Draper Arms. Malty, sweet and light, with a slight metallic after taste

Re-rate after checklist:
old score: 5/3/6/3/13=3.00
smell - weak, metallic (its from can), some hops maybe.
Foam - medium thick, to thin side, bit watery, gets watery more you keep it in, bit soft, some weak bitterness.
Appearance - clear yellow to amber side, with some bubbles.
Taste - medium strong to weak bitterness, hops, some citrus, quite easy drinking, taste is better than smell for sure.

In general OK lager, but you can get about same locally for lower price.
Heerlijk moutig en bitter pils bier. Veel smaken van graan, hop en mouten. -backlog de BierApp-

Tylko mi po nim nie staje

17 August 2018. At Tulipan, Lesce. Cheers to Anke!
Pours clear golden with a lasting, small, frothy, white head; little lacing. Aroma of corn syrup, maize, white bread, white sugar, faint honey, esters even, grass, hint of hand soap. It tastes light to medium maize-like sweet, bready & sugary with hint of honey & banana, and light grainy bitter, yeasty too. Dryish, grainy finish, corn-like sweetish in the back. Light body, slick texture, fizzy carbonation. No, if I want it sweet I'd prefer the Dunkel.
caramel, cereal, spruce, dough, butterscotch, amber, cloudy, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel, lively, long finish,
Největší zklamání. Chuťově se nijak neliší od 10 či 11. Absolutní propadák bez řízu, chuti, hořkosti.
Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, na potrzeby uzupełnienia profilu.
Przyjemny dobry lager. Duża piana przy nalewaniu, mało chmielowe piwo,  w swoim przedziale cenowym wybija się przed inne masowe lagery.
Aromat słodowy, gdzieś może w oddali chmiel. W smaku słodowe, wodniste, troszkę chmielowe. Końcówka jakby chemiczno - chmielowa. W sumie nie aż takie koszmarne.
Kolor jasny, słomkowy. W aromacie trochę mokrego zboża i mokra szmata. W smaku pusto, goryczki brak
0,5l can.Megjelenésre tipikus lager sör, kicsit sötétebb sárga, borostyánba hajló. Illatra nem karakteres édeskés maláta. Ízében sem érzek semmi izgalmat enyhén keserű. Nyári szomjoltó nem több.

Sampled from 0.5 l can from local 'Billa', best before December 2018. Clear, golden with a thin, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, a bit grassy-spicy aroma of grains and some straw. Moderately sweet, slightly bitter, gently grassy-spicy taste of grains, some straw and traces of honey, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly grassy-spicy finish. Almost medium-bodied, smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Decent Lager.
07-07-18 // bottle shared. Clear darker golden, small white head. Sweetish malty with a solid herbal bitterness. Okay.

Can, 500 ml. Wow, very tyipical, well made Czech lager. The Brewery is producing since 1874, which is impressive. In 2002, Kozel merged with the brewery Radegast and the Pilsner Urquell brewery conglomerate SABMiller. In 2016 it was one of the brands sold by SABMiller to Asahi Breweries as a result of the acquisition of the former by ABInBev. Dark golden/amber colour, white foam is collapsing, but thin head stays for a while before disappearing. Aromas are amazingly rich for a lager, toasted bread and caramel inside, very rich palate with pleasent bitterness. Very well made stuff, clean and long aftertaste, this is the beer u wanna drink every time, because it's so rich and flavourful for a lager, u can't be disappointed with. Definately a good one, it's a nice choice every time.
0,5 l Flasche. Goldenes Bier, stabiler weißer Schaum. Riecht nach Heu, leicht herb. Schmeckt leicht getreidig, malzig süß, dezent bitter.
Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji na potrzeby uzupełnienia profilu.
Gold. Thin head. Aroma intensity 3.5/5. Hay and leather aroma. Light bitter. Light to medium body
Pas si mauvaise que ça, bien meilleure que la blonde que je trouve trop acide.
Lijepa zlatna boja,fin miris i okus...zasladjeno taman po mjeri...idealno uz rostilj ili nekaj s raznja

Bottle courtesy of "HenrikSoegaard", 4%. Clear golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, grainy and cardboard. Flavour is malt, grainy, cardboard, little sweet, hop, thin, little grass and a little bitter.
Bottle 500ml. Golden color. Slightly better Czech Lager. Balanced Sweet maltyness with medium bitterness. Although Kind of mild Taste with low crispness. (Low)- Medium body.
Clear amber-gold with a quickly vanishing white head. Malt, grains, iron, orange, soap. Dominant medium bitterness, light to medium sweetness. Average carbonation, dry bitter finish.
Złociste, wysoka piana. Jakaś słaba nuta chmielowa, nic się nie dzieje. W smaku już chmielu brak. Słodowo-ścierkowe. nie za przyjemne.

Has a smoothly bitter taste, a soft malt and hops scent and sparkles perfectly. This highly malted beer is considered to be an excellent lager both at home and abroadThis beer is also brewed at "Plzensky Prazdroj (SABMiller)" in Plzen, Czech Republic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Prakticky tady přidávám tento komentář, jen aby tady něco bylo, protože zpětně dopisuji 900 piv z mého seznamu a asi bych se musel u toho zbláznit.

Mal som uz dlhsie doma a dnes som si nan spomenul. Vona sladka, mierne kovova. Pena prekvapujuco vcelku drzi asi ze nie je podchladene). Farba medova, nie moc bleda. Chut sladkasta, nie extra vyrazna, kovova, na konci skor vadi.
Tap in a bar in Darwen. Nose is butter, citrus, spruce. Palate is bread and butter, citrus, orange. Very quaffable, but nothing special.

(bottle 0,5l)

Aroma: Light malty.

Appearance: Clear golden. Minimal white head.

Taste: Medium sweet, malty, light bitter.

Palate: Medium body. Bitter finish.

Overall: Not bad.

Smell of malt, bread, grain. Golden colour, white head. Aroma of malt, grain, straw. Bitter. Highly malty flavour. Lively carbon, half-heavy body thanks to maltiness. Packs a quite nice amount of character.
Pivo u flaši. Nešto slabije Češko pivo ali još uvjek bolje od svih naših makro pivovara. Više okusa slada i ljepša gorčina nego kod "naših" "velikoserijskih" lagera.

Review: 500ml Bottle of Kozel Premium: ABV: 4.8% vol 

The award winning beer, coming in a lovely brown bottle with that oh so cool logo of the drinking goat, excellent. 

On pour got a clear golden yellow colour with a white fluffy head.

Some small carbonation going on, buzzing along nicely. Head dies.

Had a very light beery smell, yeasty with lots of malts, but overall it was quite a faint smell. 

Got a nice warm and sweet feeling on the initial taste, a nice big mouthful. Malty, very malty.

Tastes not really hitting me but man it is so drinkable, could nearly down it in one go. This beer is very smooth, so easy to drink. I like it!

Pure malt, with little sign of the hops, low bitterness.

Not the best tasting beer, very mild with the tastes, but oh my god it is so smooth and crisp. Good solid beer, you can’t go wrong.

Had a good few of these beers in the session and the next day I felt fine which was a bonus. Just goes to show that its a good clean beer. Nice.
Pours clear old gold colour with a minimal head, that quickly disappears. Malt and bread aroma. Tastes like sugary water.
Boca 0.5, zlatne boje, pjena brzo nestala, sladno, tradicionalni hmelj u pozadini, lagani diacetil...
Backlog. Zapach: słodko-słodowy, sikaczowy. Smak: delikatny słód z kontrą ziemistego chmielu na niskim poziomie. Lepsze niż się spodziewałem. Wygląd: Sikacz bez piany.
Pours from the bottle clear gold with a stable one finger white head and visible fizzing, soapy aroma, bitter start with a sweeter finish, good lawnmower beer
Gyllengul öl med ett större, småbubbligt skum. Doft och smak är söt maltighet, lättare karamelltoner, hö och viss humlighet.

0,5 l can   BB 17.06.18   
Aroma is bread, cereal, dia / butter, dark golden color, clear and with a minimal white foam head.  medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation,

500ml can from the shop, drunk at home. Pours clear with a brief frothy head, slight lacing, no bead. Deep golden amber in colour. Light aroma of bread, hay and corn. In the mouth, medium carbonation, richer flavours of yeast, malt, bread and corn, but bitterness soon quashes the taste and leaves little to enjoy or remember. Overall, a premium lager at a premium price that doesn't live up to expectations
Złoty kolor, ładna piana. Aromat i smak słodowo-chmielowy. Nieźle zabalansowane. Całkiem przyjemny czeski lager
Poured golden with a wispy white head. Smooth with a lingering bitterness. Caramel, bread, slight citrus flavour. Not bad, not great

Pours clear golden with a foamy white head. Aroma is malty with moderate notes of grass. Taste is mild and rather malty. Finishes with a nice crispy touhch of hops. Well-balanced brew. A good one for a bulk brew. (500ml can, labeled as "Kozel Premium 4,6%)
Tap. Golden with thin white foam. Nicely carbonated with a more fuller flavour than other similar beers.
Kind of tastes like you ain't cleaned ya lines for weeks, although it doesn't come with the cringey after taste. It's what I like to call a "shall we just neck it" beer.

Appearance Clear gold, small white head 

Aroma Malt, liquorice root, herbal and mildly spicy noble hops, biscuits, hay 

Taste Sweet, mildly bitter 

Palate Medium full body, mild carbonation

overall excellent and high quality Czech lager which has a dry aftertaste. never tried in a bottle, but on draught it is an exquisite an example of lager as i’ve ever come across in the Czech Republic. probably consumed gallons of this at Obscene Extreme festival.

Rich golden color with a quickly dissolving white head. Light body, medium carbonation, minimal lacing. Smell of biscuits, caramel, malts, hay, grass and cooked vegetables, with some metallic and floral notes in between. Taste is mildly citrusy and hoppy, with some bitterness in the finish. Quite complex for its type. Decent, smooth and enjoyable.

F: not big, off-white, good retention.
C: gold, clear.
A: malty, caramel, light grassy and bready.
T: malty, caramel, bread, dry bitter finish, medium body, medium carbonation, almost good, 0,5l can from Coop Jednota Martin-Záturčie.

Blonde dorée et mousse écumeuse. Un nez de céréales et de malt pilonne. Des saveurs croustillantes, un goût savonneux, alors qu’un arrière-goût amer et herbacé s’étend doucement. Tout est en douceur. (2261-250717)

Dorato limpido con cappello di schiuma fine e dalla lunga persistenza. Al naso erbaceo e lieve diacetile, su crosta di pane. Al palato miele ed amaro erbaceo finale. Corpo watery e carbonazione medio bassa.

Pours an average amount of foamy head and goes down to a thin layer. Has a pale straw coloured appearance. Aromas of grains, wheats and malts. Mild malty flavours, light roasted malts. Nothing out of the ordinary here, just another lager coming from a country with more beer consumers per capita than anywhere else. Fairly creamy mouthfeel with average carbonation. Medium retention. Not bad.

Can: 500 ml, Price: 0,95 eur 

?altas tinkamas vartojimui..

Bottle.
Dark yellow, clear, small head. Aroma: malty, hay, light fruity. Taste: bitter with sweet notes. Light body.
Sasvim solidna piva, osvježavajući lager, al slabe arome.....................
Realy good beer, Don’t know what to write. It is not specific kind. Just another good beer.
From old tasting notes. Brassy gold color. Fluffy white head. Assertive sweet malty nose. Crisp semisweet malt flavor is atypical of the Czech style. Plenty of Saaz hops throughout.
God, typisk tjekkisk øl.Dejlig frisk, med ganske høj maltindhold. God bitterhed i smagen-
Limenka - 0,5L - lager kao lager, ništa posebno...više sam očekivao od ovoga piva
Clear golden beer with small white head. Aroma is malty, grassy and bread. Taste is sweet malty, light bitter hops. Light body, thin texture. Crispy and refreshing beer.

Can. Clear yellow body, big white head with good retention and lots of lacing. Pleasant aroma of grains, fresh cut grass, mineral water, a touch of peppercorn. Taste of grains, mineral water, light bitter herbs, hints of spices. Textbook pilsner.
clear golden colour with medium head, aroma is malty , hoppy a litlte bit , tastes like a avereage lager, nice bitterness .

Can, 0.5l. Clear golden pour with two finger creamy white head. Pretty good retention, decent lacing. Malty nose, subtle hops in the background, slightly grassy. 

Thin to medium body with average carbonation. Moderately bittersweet. Aroma very basic, malty and grainy, touch of hops. Aftertaste a bit weird, cooked vegetables and hay. Some slight sour notes.

Overall, ok. Average at best, drinkable.
Pours clear gold with a fast fading white head. Malt, carmel and bread aroma and flavours. An average lager.
Clear golden, white frothy head. Clean pilsner malts and spicy hops on aroma. Light to medium body. Crisp taste with solid Saaz bitterness. Good one
Typowe czeskie piwo jednak z większą ilością aromatu. Smak słodowy, karmel, chmiel. Goryczka średnio-niska.
Keg at the Counting House, Eastborune. Hugely tinny lager and not particularly smooth either. Had it better before elsewhere.

Appearance: golden, rocky head, white foam, does not last. Aroma: bread, alcohol, sour. Taste: medium bitterness, lightly sour, bread taste, hoppy, light sweetness. Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, astringent, long finish, bitter.
Better than the standard light lager, so good for the style. When fresh and cold it’s a great helles, i don’t see it as a pilsner though. Rewe dresden
Bottle; pours clear gold with a white head; aroma of malt, floral hops, and a hint of caramel; taste is light bitter with malt, grass, and hints of caramel; finish is dry and a touch bitter

I’ve had this a hundred times and only now found our I have forgotten to rate it! Yellow-red body, big white head. Aroma of hops, paper. The taste is fresh with some malt in the finish. Refreshing and neat.
Bière blond foncé avec quasiment pas de mousse. Goût passable: un je ne sais quoi me dérange. Bue en bouteille de 50cl, à la maison avec un bon livre à lire.
Flaske fra Riga. Aroma, malt, noe søtlig, frukt. Utseende klar gylden med lett hvitt skum. Smak malt, eple, noe karamell. helt grei lagerøl, noe bitterbesk.

Bottle. Clear golden colour with a medium fine pored white head, nose is grainy, spicy, grassy and buttery with an almost meaty note, taste is sweet and malty with a fruity hoppiness towards the moderately dry finish, a creamy mouthfeel and a full body.

Can. Clear, dark gold with a big, frothy white head. Aroma of sweet malts, slightly toasty, floral hops, grass, light tobacco notes, hay, slightly bready. Taste is lightly sweet, turns lightly bitter. Lean medium body with lively carbonation, and a bittersweet finish, reminiscent of buttery toffees, grains. 

Strong presence of malt all the way through, spiced up with floral hops. Pretty intense for a Czech Pilsner, toasty and slightly sweet. Liked it.
Does not stand up to the great Czech pilsners, has a rather macro taste and character
Bottle. Clear golden colour with stable head off. Aroma and taste almost the same, malty, bread,moderate bitter finish

Rami Rami is drinking a Kozel Premium by Pivovar Velké Popovice at Alžbetka - cukráreň-kaviareň

Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Enjoyed: On tap (Flumen Pub). 
Appearance: Clear dark golden colour, with rich foam. 
Aroma: Hint of malt; usual lager. 
Palate: Watery (but not sparsely), light carbonation.
Taste: Bread; Light bitter aftertaste.
Overall impression: Light, drinkable. Quite ok, but I expected more.

Edit:
Enjoyed: Poured from bottle into mug. 
Appearance: Clear golden colour, medium head which soon fades.
Aroma: Malt, grains, hint of hops.  
Palate: Medium body, moderate carbonation.	
Taste: Malt, grains, hops, bitter with dry aftertaste.
Overall impression: Good, tasty, drinkable but nothing remarkable.

0,5 boks på hotellbalkongen i Makarska: klar gylden med fint skum som varer. Mild og fint balansert humleinntrykk både i aroma og smak. En god og lettdrikkelig pilsner, vesentlig bedre enn de kroatiske som sjappene og "super"markedene er fylt av. Deilig floral bitterhet i ettersmaken.

500ml bottle into shaker. Doughy sweet malt nose with a little pepper. Clear yellow amber beer with a few derisory bubbles and a tiny collar of suds. Oh dear..... Slight tingle on the tongue, medium body. Tinny bitterness then a swamp water grainy sweetness takes over and lingers. Very poor, avoid if possible.

Copenhagen 13/9 2016. 50 cl bottle from Meny, Østerfælled Torv, Kh Ø. The characteristic drawing of a goat trying to drink beer on the label. Looks kind of clumsy trying to hold the beer glass between it’s forelegs. But it gets points for trying. 

Pours clear yellow with small white head. Settles as thin layer of foam. Moderate lacing. 

Aroma is malty with some sour notes and a hint of butter. 

Medium carbonation and watery texture. 

Flavor is medium sweet followed by slightly more distinct bitterness. 

Not anything overwhelming but a little bitter edge. Not fantastic - but a nice beer for your lunch.

Aromat: karton, estry i trochę słodu
Wygląd: barwa złota, klarowne, piana biała, nietrwała, opada do cienkiej warstwy, nawet ładnie zdobi szkło
Smak: lekko słodkie, wodniste, słodowe, karton również w smaku, goryczka niska, ale przyjemna
Podniebienie: nagazowanie i pełnia średnie, pijalne

Bright golden color with a moderate amount of activity. Slightly frothy white 2 finger head, lasting around 5 to 10 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas of sweet grains and corn with a faint floral feel. Flavors of sweet malt with corn, slight lemon, a hint of caramel, and some herbal spices. Bready and grassy. Lots of sugar.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation. Light and short sugary finish, ending with a pleasant lingering feel of noble spices.

Overall below average in quality being too faint and slightly stale, overly sugary and missing some sharpness.
0.5l can. Malty aroma, caramel notes. Clear golden color, thin white head. Malty taste, notes of caramel. Light body, oily texture, average carbonation and light bitter finish.

Tall can from BC Liquor Store, Brentwood in north Burnaby.Pale yellow, lotsa white foam, sickly sweet nose. No flavor highlights here, folks. Vaguely tastes of highly processed cereals. No hops so’s I could discern. Yikes! 1.4

Tämä versio Premium, mutta 4,6%, maitokaupasta ostettuna. Onko Premium-version prosentteja siis laskettu vai onko kyse Mediumista? No, joka tapauksessa kullankeltainen olut runsaalla valkoisella vaahdolla. Tyylikkään näköinen olut. Tuoksu varsin mieto, peruslagermainen. Maku maltainen, hieman tunkkainen, ei kovin erikoinen.
Can. Pours clear golden with medium frothy head. Aroma is malts and caramel. Taste is crisp, clean and honest sweet and bitter. Fresh.

A classic czech one. It?s a very pleasant beer, refreshing, absolutely not remarkable but still cool to drink. Real beer taste, not watered like premium Gambrinus to make a comparison. Enjoy it with a good meal or at a bar, that?s how it works best! APPROVED BY TAVERNY?S BLACK METAL CREW!
500ml can at Motrych’s (damn you, George!). Pours a clear golden with no head. Aroma is malty, flower hops. Same taste. Meh.

Starts with quite nice Pils aroma, mostly malty, light caramel, light grassy hops, but then comes watery even plastic aftertaste that quite ruins all of it. Light sweetness with light bitterness.
Drinkable, but one time try.

0.5 l can. Clear golden color, nice white head. Malts dominate in aroma, but some grassy notes are also present. Bittersweet taste, not too complicated, but quite well balanced. Medium bitterish finish, lively carbonation, light body. Nice brew.
Den gode pislner-smag, uden at være for humlet. Virker lidt blød i smagen (hvis der er noget der kan det), måske skyldes det humlen, der ikke træder for meget igennem.

50 cl bottle. Slightly hazy, golden colour with a thin, white head. Sweet aroma with pale malts, grasses and sweet fruits. Floral notes. Taste is lightly bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and slightly bitter with pale malts and grasses. Nice Czech pils.

From a 500mL can. Very smooth medium hop taste, slight malty aroma, and light head. It is advertized as highly hopped but did not get that. The taste was medium sweetness and bitterness with light sourness. Palate was light and the finish was smooth. Overall, a great beer for its style and thought it was well balanced Czech beer. I would recommend as a great introductory beer to Czech style.
50 cl. flaske. 4,8 %. Endnu en fantastisk øl fra tjekkiske Kozel. Semi brun øl med en dejlig balance. Bare en super duper øl. Købt hos MENY
Good Czech lager. Pours crystal clear, generous head. Sweet and bitter and malty. It’s not complicated but it is tasty and refreshing. Better than some of the more famous Czech exports.
2016 - 05 - 24 500ml bottle. orange golden colour. small white head. hay and leather in aroma. light bitter taste.

It is a pity that the big groups bought almost all these traditional macrobreweries. Even though, This one is honest, yellow gold body, white and thin head, normal carbonation, grainy, sweet and some hop, it could be saaz, a bit watery.
0.5l can. Golden body, thin white head. Both the aroma and the taste is dominated by the sour grainy malts with a hint of spicy hops. A below average macro lager.
tap @ czech. gold colour, light body, high carbonated, easy to drink, everyday pilsner
Clear straw colored. small quickly diminishing white head. Aroma of malts. Rich taste with low to medium bitterness. No traces of corn. A bit overcarbonated. Not too bad.
For a premium beer it has no body, very light taste, no good appearencein the glass so overall a low class lager-like. Not recomended.
Goldgelb schaum ok, Geruch getreidig wenig hopfen, Geschmack recht einfach leichter hopfen überwiegen Getreide wenig herb, recht süffig
500ml Flasche. Goldgelbes Bier, fester Schaum. Herb-süsslicher Duft. Geschmack nach Malz und Getreide. Recht rund.

After dtinking only IPA for some time, I am schockef how bad light bears are in comparison. Howerver the color is a nice gold, got it in a can, you can almost feel the aroma, the taste is somewhat fruity but wanishes after 2sec. Maybe chilling it a bit more would be better. One positive thing is its foaminess.
Хороший лагер - приятный свежий вкус - слабый аромат цитрусов - средняя горечь.
Can - Light caramel, apple and some grains. Clear gold with a rich white head. Light sweet grains and a touch of bitterness in the finish. Not that bad.

Botella 50 cl tomada en Praga marzo 2000. Sin Fcprf. Lote 14050 1(coleccion). (r563) etiquetado antiguo como yelkopopovicky Premium. 5 vol. Pocos recuerdos. Cuerpo ligero fácil de beber. Sin mucho más.
Clear golden color with small white head. Some light malty aroma. Surprisingly good and not plain and watery.

Pours a clear gold with a large but short-lived white head. Aromas are grains and some lemon. Tastes are grains, slight caramel malt, a little tinny. Thin body, slight acidic bite, short tinny aftertaste. Not one of the Czeck Republic’s finer offerings.
Keg at Gunmakers Arms; clear straw yellow pour with a creamy white head, aroma has light malts, taste has creamy malts, some bready action a hint of lemon.

Bottle. Straw golden colored and clear with a full white head. Grainy smell, with some hints of caramel and a light floral note. Balanced sweet bitter flavor with a focus on a bitter freshness. Light bodied, crisp with high carbonation. Taste is also grainy and caramel, but gains a spicy hoppy note. Pleasent, medium strong aftertaste.
Terrible at all levels. Just impossible to enjoy at any single level. Whata horrible experience! one of the worst lagers I have ever encountered.

Bottle 0.5l. Clear, gold colored. AROMA- malt. FLAVOR- slightly sweet, slightly bitter, cardboard, malt. Light bodied.
Bad one.

#476
Bottle 0.5l. Clear straw golden body, medium white head. Aroma of low intensity: malts, bisquits. Taste is neutral with slightly bitter-sweet finish. Old paper, malts. Empty light to medium body, moderately carbonated. 
Much more pale lager than Czech pilsener. Bad one.

Ordinary, ordinary, ordinary, boring, boring, boring product of SAB Miler. Watery, thin, I thought it is nonalcoholic beer. Who can like and drink that regularly? Only Robinson Crusoe on a faraway deserted island! No taste, no palate, no aroma. Just some urine colours. Now and never.

0.5 l bottle, Sheridan’s Pub, Zagreb. Clear golden, bubbles, steady small white head. Aroma of malts, hay and bread. Traditional taste, appetizing, sweet and malty. Medium body, soft to medium carbonation. Bready aftertaste. Very good.

Can from sobeys. Pours golden yellow with an island like head. No aroma to speak of. Slightly sweet but nothing there. Taste is well. .... tasteless. Somewhat malty with a hint of some bitterness. Thin mouthfeel. Thinly carbonated. I feel like this is an old can. I guess that’s the chance you take buying beer from the other side of the world.
500 ml can. Bought in a supermarket in Belgrad. Godlen color with white head. Malty smell, but not deep, mostly boring. Soft hop smell, and kind of sweet ending. Good, but not great.

Bottle. Clear gold with a beautiful foamy white head. Aroma of grains and floral noble hops. Taste is grains, malts and floral and slightly spicy hops. Medium bitterness. Medium carbonation. Soft mouthfeel. Refreshing and nice enough. Goes well with Pizza.
Flaske. Farven er ravgylden og skummet er hvidt og fast. Aromaen er citrusfrugter og krydderier og smagen er malt og humle.
Very slight aroma. Taste is very crisp and clean, not too many flavours to pick out which is not always bad. This beer is light, simple and perfect on a hot summers day.
Clear golden with small white head. Little bit old aroma with hints of leather cloves and fruits. Taste is waterlike, quite light and some sides of grapefruit. Rather not good.

Pours a golden colour with a hint of amber, with a nice tight white head that retains well. Teste of yeast and some malt and a dryish sweet finish.
Lots of carbonation and a notch up from a light body.
Very solid beer.

500ml bottle. I love the cerny so had high hopes, but ended up being disappointed. Nothing that wrong with it, just didn’t impress - "just a beer" where as I’d rather chase down something special. Middle of the road.

Appearance: clear straw with two fingers of fluffy white head, good retention and patchy lacing. (3/5) Aroma: floral/grassy, pale biscuity malt, honey. (5/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild bitter. (5/10) Palate: light body, moderate carbonation, off-dry crisp finish. (3/5)

Pretty easy drinking, sweetish on the front end with a pleasant off-dry finish. Definitely better than most pale lager/euro lager/pils, and leagues ahead of macro stuff. I know the deScription sounds like a pretty typical macro pils, but it’s far cleaner and better balanced. But, ultimately it’s a pils, so it’s hardly gonna be challenging, regardless. (11/20)

some caramel, very little floral hops. some dms (cooked vegetables), diacetyl.
pale, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, good retention.
light sweetness, very little bitterness. kind of empty. 
light body, thin feel, lively, short finish with slight bitterness. drinkable but nothing special for the style. should be more complex with more aroma and flavour

Can. Small white head. Yellow color. Metallic, grainy, bready smell. In flavor: grass, bread, hay. Thankfully no metallic flavors. Overall: better than commercial pilsner but worse than average Czech pilsner. Maybe, some Czech hops are substituted with cheap hops.

Bottle 18.01.16. Aroma of cooked vegetables mixed with herbal hops, iron and bit of flowers. Golden coloured, clear beer. White head on two fingers, dissapears fast. Strongly bitter - herbs and little sweet in taste - barley, bread and yeast with alcohol and iron. Medium, short, dry bitterness on finish. High carbonation and medium body. Drinkable, but with defects.
Light with clear colour and white head. Citrus notes , bitter taste . Overall nothing special.

Bottle 0.5
Добротный чешский пилснер. Все по канонам. Мне понравилось. Классика.

Bottle sample. Clear light golden with small white head. The aroma has notes of honey and sweetish fruits (peach, citrus). Sweetish fruity flavor with notes of honey, some graininess, bitterish with some lemon. Light-bodied.

From a can. Fresh floral aroma. Pours golden in colour with a frothy white head. Well carbonated. Light hoppy flavour with some metallic and grassy notes. Medium bodied. More bitterness in the finish. 
Earlier Rating: 9/1/2015 Total Score: 2.7
From a can. Fresh floral aroma. Pours golden in colour with a frothy white head. Well carbonated. Light hoppy flavour with some metallic and grassy notes. Medium bodied. More bitterness in the finish.
bread, hay, floral, alcohol, clear, golden, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, lively,
From a bottle. Clean malt aroma, crisp with a dry finish, not usually my style but this was a surprise.
Pint can pours a clear golden with a large white head. Aroma of muted sweet biscuit honey malt with light hops. Sweet malt flavor, with light yeast and light hop bitterness. Ok, drinkable.
On tap chiara limpida cereale discreta secchezza amaro medio non molto intensa un filo erbaceo
Une blonde légère pour laquelle je n’avais aucune attente mais qui m’a surpris agréablement j’y reviendrai certainement

18/VII/15 - 50cl bottle from local supermarket Olomouc @ home - BB: 5/VII/15 (they sold me this on 5/VII!) (2015-934)  


Clear orange beer, small creamy off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very malty, grains, grassy, some citrus. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bit sweet, malty, nice bitterness, bit grassy, some caramel. Aftertaste: hoppy, bitter, grassy, some citrus, dry finish. This ain’t too bad! I’ve always liked Kozel, ever since I walked into U Cerneho Vola in Prague and had two of their beers on draft. Too bad I didn’t take notes back then! :p

Pours a clear, golden color, topped with an average sized white head. Malty aroma, some mild grassy and grainy notes. Taste starts a bit on the sweet side, malty with mild bitterness in the finish. Pretty decent one.

(Can, 0.5 l - 4.6 % ABV, 20150730) The beer poured pale golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had sweetness and herbalness. Palate was light bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was mildly bitter. A rather thin pale lager.

A golden beer, a head is white and almost medium. Aroma has strong malts, some grass, pure. Taste has light malts, only hint of grassy bitterness but still not too sweet. ruohoista Medium bodied, quite smooth and nicely to drink. Easy to enjoy, power of malts.

BB 15.01.16. Poured a crystal clear light amber colour with 5mm of white foam for a head that retained OK and laced OK. Carbonation low and coarse. Aroma malty with no obvious hops. Taste sweetish and malty with no real bitterness. Light body. Crisp and light.
I expected Czech to do better. Not the best Czech beer in every aspect. Very disappointed. Very light and no head.

Canned. Looks really bright, the color of amber or gold. Visible fizz, almost no head. Aroma reminds honey and the smell of field during the sunny day - really dry and kind of sweet. Taste is light, Appreciable fizz, beer remains bitter on the tongue while aftertaste.

Light pleasant dry grass and honey aroma, sunny orange color with light head appearance. Sweet taste with medium bitter aftertaste. Preaty sticky beer, but very lively carbonation, with bitter finish.
Ot, przeciętny lager, z lekki aromatem mokrego kartonu i lekką chlebowością w aromacie. Nic specjalnego.
Zahvaljujuci mom prijatelju Miru (bizonu) ponovno sam probao ovo pivo ..dobar okus ...pivo koje se moze piti ..dobro za odmor uz pivo ..
Decent Czech Pilsner (Světlý) style beer. Hoppy bitter taste and hoppy bitter palate. Good.

On the way home from Canada we stopped at the beer store and picked up several single 500 ml cans of beers that looked interesting. This was one of them. I try not to be mean when reviewing beer but this was a disappointment. The best part of the experience was the wicked picture of the goat on the bottle gripping the beer between his front hooves ready to quaff a cold brew after a long day of munching grass in the hot sun and other general ungulate frolicking. The appearance is a crystal clear straw yellow with a nice bubbly head. Nothing wrong with the palate. No taste of malt, hops, beer or really anything. Leave this one to the goats.

500ml bottle. Best before 07.06.15. Pale gold colour with an adequate, off white head which reduced to a ring and left minimal lacing. Floral aroma with malt, grain, grass, honey and sulphur. Medium sweetness and light to medium bitterness. Medium body, smooth yet sticky texture, soft carbonation and a gentle, lingering, semi-dry bitterness in the finish. Pretty decent.
Bottle 500 ml. Bad bad aroma, similar taste. Surprisingly poor in every possible aspect.
Pint from Stags Head Hoxton. Crisp, refreshing lager with a reasonable depth to it
500ml bottle. Pours clear gold with a white head. Grassy aroma. Taste is malt, grassiness, honey. Light bitterness in the finish. Decent Czech pilsner.
50cl can. Pours golden color with medium white head. Smell is weak and unrecognizable. Taste is malty, a little bit sweet, with bitterness in the end. Aftertaste has some bitter off taste.
Golden colour with white head. Sweet hoppy aroma with the same flavour. Medium carbonation and bitterness, hoppy finish but overall not superlative.
Very good Pilsner. Nice slight reddish color, Good aroma and a very good taste.
500ml can. Clear golden with a frothy white head. Flavors are yeast, bread, honey, orange, grass with floral and fruity notes. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.
Naprawdę bardzo przeciętny. Kiedyś bardziej mi smakował. Teraz chyba wolałbym NOXa z Carlsberga wypić.
Clear yellow body... white thick head... Aroma is caramel...Taste is quite sweet with low bitterness....
0.5l bottle. Clear golden color with nice white head and high carbonation. Aroma of biscuit, fruits and grass. Taste is little sweet and bitter. Very nice beer.
Plechovka, pekná farba aj pena, príjemná vôňa. Vyvážená sladová chuť, bez horkosti, ale pije sa príjemne. Najlepší Kozel.

Keg at some sports bar in Canary Wharf, London. It pours a clean golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is grainy grassy lightly citrusy with mild biscuity notes. Taste is crispy an grassy, grainy with notes of hay brad and biscuit. Light bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, above average.

zapach bardzo delikatny, słody i lekki alkohol. kolor złoty, lekko ciemnawy, klarowne. piana bardzo słaba i znika momentalnie. w smaku pełny, słodki, nieco przyciężkawy, lekko daje kurzem i ogonkami z jabłek. goryczka niewysoka, i trzeba jej szukać, ale jak się ją znajdzie to jest czysta i dość krótka. wysokie nasycenie

.5l can from Lutakko Supermarket 
Pours clear golden with medium high, white head. Aroma is butter, malts, grainy and bread notes. Flavor is mostly same mixed with nice bittery palate. Sparkling and bready.

Jaune pâle avec un col blanc moyen qui rétréci après quelques minutes laissent les belles dentelles. L’arôme des céréales et du malt léger un très peu sucré avec un très peu d’houblon. Le goût est des graines, un peu du pain, du malt et un peu d’houblon floral. Très bien équilibré avec pas mal du corps pour le style. Un petit peu sucré avec une finale plutôt sec.

Keg at U Černého Vola Day 1 of Fergus and Sarah’s Czech jaunt. 29/09/14. Bright yellow coloured pour with a big sticky white head. Aroma is subdued pils grains, grain store, little nobel hop. Flavour is composed of quite sweet pils grains, light honey sweetness, light spicy nobel hop, Palate is semi-sweet, highish carbonation. Little lingering caramel and apple. Pretty inoffensive.

At BeerLand pub in Smederevo-Serbia. Pours filtered yellow, medium small white head leaving drafts. Nose: grainy, hay, honey, floral notes. Mouth: grassy overall light bitterness, medium maltiness. Ok 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can from Eurospar, Rennweg, Wien. Rich and malty aroma, a bit of wood. Soft texture and carbonation. Tangible hop bite. Very drinkable. Enjoyable.
Pours straw clear lots head some lacing. Nose sweaty socks. Flavs cereal some light fruit. Taste light sweet light biter. Light mouth lively carb.

チェコビール  
梅のような香りと若干の酸味

It’s a pretty standard lager. Pours clear gold. A little bit of a earthy taste with some malts, not much bitterness but a nice enough palate and some carbonation. Easy beer to drink, I wouldn’t mind drinking it just as a standard drinking beer, though it’s nothing special.

Sometimes I think I may just be the last guy on ratebeer who actually digs a decent pilsner. While this isn’t great, it is a decent Czech pilsner. It has the two things I dig in a pils: the delicate flowery hop (which lets face it should & could be fresher) & that back of the throat briskness. I like this style at the end of session, after a bunch of hop bombs or tight stouts.
Keg in the Racehorse, Kettlewell. A typical lager in looks and taste. Not much flavour to report. Mild grass, citrus and metallic notes. A bit crap.

500 ml bottle. clear gold color with white foam. taste are similar to other Czech pilsners some kind sweetness with hops bitter and grass notes. medium Czech pilsner but drinkable if u like that stile
Can 0.5l at Super Vero market Belgrade Serbia.Pour it golden color with small white head.Taste and aroma of malt, little bit honey.Decent, good balanced, has a good figurr and drinkable.

50cl can from Balti jaama Selver, Tallinn. Pours clear golden with a white head. Mild malty aroma with some grassy and slightly fruity notes. Moderate sweet with mild malty and hoppy flavours and a fairly decent bitterness. Medium to light body with quite average carbonation. Pleasant and easy to drink, but nothing special.

Tall white head, clear golden body, crocheted lacing.
Aroma; yellow apples, raisins, grass, sweet malts.
Taste; caramel malts, bread, grass, hops, grains, yellow apple, mists of lemon.
Normal on palate, carbonation and body. Finish includes bread. 
Pretty alright dvanáctka, slightly modest on abv.
[50cl brown btl 4.8%abv° BB16.10.14 B@cz.republ, T11/11@RuneSession]
smells like any old bland lager, pale gold with white lacing on top, tastes just like a really bland boring lager.

500ml bottle, kindly shared by djoeye. Solid, bubbly white lacing-head over a clear golden coloured body. Mild malty sweetness on the nose, some grass as well. Taste of brown malts with citric hints. Clean and soft in the mouth. Medium to thin bodied (Tromsø 11.11.2014).

Aroma is dry euro malts, sulphur and light sweet malts. Taste is sweet malts with a crisp finish. Light bitterness follows and finishes smoothly. Fairly basic complexity. Appearance is a clear straw with a pearl head that retains fairly well.

Golden brown color with a small, quite persisting head. Strong hoppy aroma, with floral overtones and a hint of toffee. Quite a smooth taste, the hops don’t come forward in so crude a way as with many other mainstream lagers. It is just bitter enough, aftertaste is very short, brown bread on the palate. Really a simple but good pilsener.
Not even sure what to write here. Serviceable pilsner. Light grain and cereal, ambiguously bitter finish. Boring but drinkable.

500ml can into English pint. Pours a clear golden-straw colour with a sparse, lasting white head. Light malty and floral hop notes (and not the awful skunkiness I feared from a new-in-town mass-produced pilsner); light crisp sweetness with moderate carbonation. Smooth and easy drinking. Not too bad an offering.
500ml can. Pours clear golden color with large white head, Malty aroma. Malty taste with very little bitterness and pleasant aftertaste.

500ml Can from LCBO. Pours a clear golden colour. Classic hay aroma with some florality and light malts. Fast flavour profile with a touch of malts and lots of cereal like flavours. THis isn’t that bad of a brew, not good but i was expecting much worse.

On tap 0.3 litres in U Cerneho Vola (Black Ox), Prague on 5th Oct 2014 just before hitting the Strahov Monastery and brewery. Nice golden hue to the clear body, good solid white blanket on top. Nice uncomplicated blend of none smelling ingredients. Slight malt lead but the hops even out any sweetness getting above itself. refreshing and crisp: a typical Czech Pilsner in fact, no better or worse than so many others.

Pours pizzy yellow with carbonated medium white head
Aromas of corn, hay, bread, malt syrup
Taste is nice and clean. Quite sweet but well balanced pilsener with ok subtle hopyness

500 ml can. Pours a clear, golden yellow with an average, frothy, white head. Sweet aroma of caramel malt and fruit. Sweet flavour of malt, caramel, fruit and a light straw note with a dry, bitter finish. Medium body with a smooth, watery texture and soft carbonation.

Has a clear, golden color, with a thin, very stable, froth head.

Contains faint aromas of wheat and straw, along with a decent infusion of herbal, grassy hops.

Tastes surprisingly characterful for what I was expecting, with toffeish, bready malts up front, along with a fitting carbonation. Slightly bitter hops get introduced to the palate along with a big load of straw and wheat. This brew is refreshing, but with a strong malt backbone, which overpoweres the hops by far, leaving only a herbal, slightly bitter touch. Finishes malty, with buttery toffee above a slightly metallic carbonation, while the hops have already been fading.

Blonde cristalline, d’un doré très jaune, avec une petite couche de mousse blanche ; le nez est de céréales blondes et de foin frais coupé. La bouche manque de ce petit kick qui fait les pilsners exceptionnelles, et un goût de sucre de maïs persiste. Par contre, les houblons sont quand même présents, la buvabilité est (sans surprise) extrême, et le goût est assez franc, avec des malts qui occupent bien les espaces vides laissés par le manque de houblons. Une pils correcte, mais loin du peloton de tête dans ce pays.

Can from the LCBO. Crystal clear light orange with a small white head that doesn’t last. Nose is hay and toffee. Mild sweet toffee throughout with only a light bitterness in the finish. Very thin with soft carbonation. Crisp but watery.

0,5l can. Draught Kozel is delicious. This one is just average. Not very tasty, but watery. A disapointment. 
Rerate on 16.3.2015: 0,5l bottle. Much better as from the can. Tastier and more drinkable. Deserves now a 3,5

Der schöne weisse Schaum sitzt fest auf dem klaren goldgelben Bier. 

Ein aromatischer Duft steigt in die Nase. 

Der erste Schluck fliesst prickelnd dem Gaumen entlang, dann leicht bitter die Kehle hinunter. 

Der Abgang und Nachhall sind ebenfalls leicht bitter. 

Ein wohlbekömmliches Bier!
Clear yellow body, white thick head. Aroma is caramel, malt. Taste is quite sweet with low bitterness. Texture is a bit thin with a light bitter finish.
Can 0.5 l, from Interspar (Ljubljana). Crystal clear dark golden liquid. Average white head. Medium body and carbonation. Well balanced and drinkable. Ok one.
Bottle. Clear yellow with a nice white head. Aroma of grains and hay. Sweetish, grassy and malty flavors, mild herbal bitterness. Light-bodied and easy to drink.

Drunk walking back to hotel un Edinburgh and ended up in very sketchy bar. Ordered this and drank quickly to try and leave ASAP. Standard pour. Slight bitter hop nose. Tastes bready, light pine, hint of metallic. Touch of bite not too bad.
This was a decent lager/pilsner, brown, flavours richer than most lagers. Good with the right food but not a beer I’d go to to savour on its own. Shared bottle at Plonk.
Little head, orange colour, clear. Bland aroma. Medium sweetness and a little bitter. Overall very boring beer.
0,5l Flasche. Goldenes Bier mit weißer Schaumkrone. Leicht malziges Aroma. Schmeckt auch so.

Aroma of wheat and malts. Pours light gold, lots of carbonation. Taste is slightly hoppy, malty, lager. Quite delicious, happily drink this all day long over domestic shite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A nice malty lager, quite smooth and flavoursome. Slight hop finish with bitter aftertaste. -- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Aroma: bread and grain malts. Appearance: clear gold, medium white creamy head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: very grainy, intense malts. Overall: decent Pilsner, but doesn’t stand out. Pint at Hospudka Sokol, Prague.

Bottle 500 ml from Aldi - Gals (CH). Luminous and crackling blonde with a nice pure white head. Laces. Malted aromas, floral, grassy and spicy hop. The taste is bitter-sweet, with floral notes, rather round with a fine bitterness that persists after a malted sweetness. Nice balance, digestible and cheap.
Draft. Amber beer with a cream head. Light malt aroma. Malt and light mineral flavor. Medium bodied. Malt and light breadiness lingers with light mineral notes.

0.5L bottle. Pours a clear golden with a frothy white head that lingers. Interesting malt aromas: vanilla, cereal, hints of molasses. Mild sweetness at the beginning with nice cereal grain flavor, sweetness more apparent in the middle, transitioning to a long, herby hop linger. Medium-light body with a creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Overall, nice overall profile. Nothing really stands out, but I could see myself drinking quite of few of these in an evening.
Bottle. Clear deep golden color, white head. Aroma is malty and dry hops. Malty body, dry hops, fresh.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Clear golden color, medium white head. Fizzy carbonation, thin body. Bitterish taste. Ordinary and boring pilsner. 
(Cubismo 0,5l bottle)

From can. medium hop aroma. light body. definite hop taste (almost tinny), but expected more. finishes with some bitterness. Something seemed off about the taste of this beer. Will have to rate again in the future.
Pale yellow with medium white head. Malts and hops on the aroma. Bitter taste from the beggining till the end.
Niezbyt gorzki, wygląd nie porywający, lecz całkiem nieźle musuje. Wrażenie ogólne- nie porywa, ale też nie jest zły.
Can. Medium white head. Clear golden. Sweet hop aroma. Taste is a tad sweet with a light bitter aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Overall a rather drinkable pilsner.

once i had a kozel in prague, and a friend of mine brought me two cans last month. it was a privileged occasion to drink kozel again. though it’s quite common in hungary, i usually don’t pick this beer. don’t know why because it’s really worth its price.
Nicht das leckerste Bier, aber in Ordnung, solange es kuehl verzehrt wird kann man auch das sehr gut geniessen!

Bouteille de 500 ml achetée à la LCBO de Cornwall. Dégustée le 8 aout 2005. Bière blonde limpide. Mousse beaucoup, col épais et durable. Odeur de céréales bien présente. Très douce, assez sucrée, assez amère en finale. Goût de céréales ressort bien. Bonne bière tchèque, bien équilibrée. Bon rapport qualité/prix.

500 ml can from the LCBO. Clear yellow with white pillowy head that sticks around. Well carbonated. Smells grassy with some floral notes.Very easy drinking. No bitterness detected, Mild taste of grainy malt. Subtle lemon/fruity aftertaste which is pleasant. OK pils.
Thin malt tones with a hint of hops. not much here, and definitely not really worth more words

Clear golden color, staying medium sized white head. No lacing. Medium body, average carbonation. Sweet malty aroma, bread, floral hops. Classic czech pilsner, nothing unexpected. Smooth. More sweet than bitter. OK, very drinkable.

500ml can. Clear medium amber, moderate head. Aroma was grassy and grainy. Taste is grass, cereal bordering on cardboard and some mild sweetness. Body was a bit more watery than I’d have liked. Overall, much more flavourful than a typical pale lager and a nice alternative.
Keg red bar wakefield. Clear amber colour halo white head. Aroma grain pale malts. Taste same over carbonated thin medium body.

500 ml can. Clear bright golden yellow, firm white foamy head settles and lasts. Aroma of sweet malt and classic saaz. Lightly sweet buttery toasted pils malt, mildly spicy herbal floral hop taste, some caramel. Average carbonation, light-medium body, moderately hopped. Light clean bitter finish. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)

Can, 0.50l. Clear golden color with large frothy white head, poor lacing and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of grassy hops, vegetables, cereals with some honeyish notes. Taste starts with moderate sweet malt, follows by grainy acidity, crispy and chalky with spicy mouthfeel and light bitter finish. Medium body, dry texture and lively carbonation in palate. Worse than I expected, but not bad indeed...
Bottled , Central Bohemia , CZ , Malt,bread,butter and grassy aroma , Clear golden color with bigger lacing head , Sweeter taste with light bitter finish , Lighter body , Soft carbon , Fairly good.
Bottle, 500 ml. Pours clear golden yellow with white head. Sweet malty aroma. Sweet malty flavor with hint of caramel.

Can 0,50L. Clear golden colour with average big, frothy, white head. Aroma of cookies, honey and grassy hops. Taste starts light bitter with some caramel and turns into moderate bitter. Watery beer with light to medium body and lively carbonation. Solid one.

Can from the LCBO, this beer pours a clear golden colour. The head is massive and soapy white, it lasts quite a long time with great lacing. Aroma notes are dominated by fruity esters like tart apple, and pear. Along with crackers, and cereal malts. This beer smells a lot like a cider! The tasting notes include more apple, and pear. The palate is quite smooth, and it finished quite peppery. Excellent Pilsner!

500 ml can. Pours a clear gold, with a 1 1/2 finger bubbly head. Some lacing, head diminished moderately quick to a light perimeter ring. Light floral and cereal notes. Sweet start. Lightly bitter finish, short lived. Thin texture. Overall not bad. Typical Lager but nothing really special.

Clear golden, white head
Cereals, yeast, a hint of hops and honey
Light hoppy bitterness ending with cardboard
Not bad

500ml bottle from Tallinn. Clear deep golden colour, large white frothy mostly diminishing head, fair bit of lacing. Moderately malty aroma of light bread and hay, light floral hops and a hint of butter. Taste is initially slightly sweet but fairly balanced and slightly acidic, turning into a lightly bitter finish with a moderately astringent feel. Medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation. Well-made if somewhat simple and uninteresting Czech pils, from the major Czech brewers pilsners I’d prefer either Budweiser or Uruquell. Very drinkable and would certainly work very well in Summer.
Bottled. Light malty aroma with a bit of flowers. Golden color with medium head. Light bitter in taste and in aftertaste.

Pours a crystal clear golden colour with a small white ring and little to no lace. Aroma is spicy/floral noble hops, pale malts, overall clean without fruity esters and a crisp complex pale malts. Taste is crisp, complex pale malts, spicy noble hops and mild rounded bitterness.

500 ml can bought at Lafaco & Co’s booth at HKCEC in Wan Chai during Hong Kong Food Festival 2013.



Clear golden yellow	colour; Three-quarter finger head and soapy white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Small sticky lacing and fizzy carbonation; Light aroma of malt, with bread, dough, light honey, light lemon and straw; Close to light sweet taste of malt, with faint honey, faint metallic, dry bread, barks, light liquorice, lemon and fairly light grass; 
Light body, thin and crisp palate; Mouth feel is light Czech Pils, with some pretty good wooden and light spice taste, not earthy though. Also some good shades of light honey, decent breadiness and good lemon, too; Hoppiness is light lemon and straw nose, good citrus, wood and light grass taste. Liquorices is pretty mild for the style and manage to give a low-fi bitter but notable low astringent finish; Dry after taste. Crisp and easy to mouth.



Comments: As Czech Pils this is pretty light weight in every aspect, but it’s also easygoing and refreshing. Neither maltyness nor bitterness is overbearing, makes it a nice Summer thirst quencher or meal companion. Decent.

500 ml can. Pours a clear golden yellow with a white, 2-3 finger head that leaves big rings of lacing. Aroma has notes of citrus bread, and caramel. Taste is a balanced bitter with hints of grain, caramel, and a touch citrus. Low-medium body with a medium carbonation. Crisp and clean in the mouth. Very refreshing. Overall a very refreshing brew. A mild aroma and taste willake it approachable by all. Might get again to change it up.
Keg @ the Albert, Norbiton. Bleurgh, standard straw coloured mass produced lager. Bog standard bad

Bottle. Clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma has grain. 

Taste has maize, grass and grain. Bitterish finish. Basic lager.

Not bad. Malty pilsner with some bitterness and faint noble hop aroma. Drinkable medium to light bodied beer with large bubbles head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A can from lidl at low price. Well chilled, no expectations. In the beginning very Sweet, then typical taste of hops in Check beer. Bitter taste stays in mouth. OK.
Nice hoppy aroma of Saaz, good healthy gold colour, malty and bitter, with grassy hoppiness, straw, and a a crispy feel. Not bad!

Bottle
Aroma-grass, malt
Appearance-golden, clear, frothy, 
Taste-light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, lively carbonation 
Overall-refreshing
Can in Moscow. Nice and smooth with a sweet malty body. Ends with a light bitterness. All in all an ok brew.
Pint in Lounge Brixton. Good carbonation. Very thin head. Bland taste. Mildly offensive on the tongue.
Clear gold with reddish hue & big fluffy white head. Sweet, grassy aroma. Light, refreshing palate.

Light amber body with pillowy white head that lasts for a while. Faint fruity breast sweet aroma. Grainy flavour. Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours pale to light golden, soapy medium top, min lasing. Aroma - mild malty, bready and light herbal hopping. Flavor is more malt oriented, light bitter with light body, watery and easy drinkable, refreshing. Sweetness is below average. Not bad but not to remember also.

Bottle. Pours a pale straw colour.

Aroma. aroma of some sweet malts.

Taste. I can taste a flavour i can best describe as a cross between lemon and rockmelon and also some other sweet flavours.

Overall. Standard beer nothing too special, good for a few.

Malty Czech pilsener. Drunk on draught.  

 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5 liter bottle at home, poured into a footed pilsner glass. ABV 4.8%
Very deep golden orange colour on the body, with huge and continuous activity in it. Tall, a bit more than two fingers, snow white and thick, soapy head, with very good retention heavy lacing left on the glass. Impressive.
Aroma is dominated by sweet, heavy malts. Maybe there are some hops in here, but tvery deeply hidden under all the maltiness. A bit of bread too.
Taste is not that bad. A roller-coaster between sweetness and bitterness. Begins quite sweet, turns to a mild bitterness , again sweet and ends up with a nice bitterness on the aftertaste, with a good duration.
Thin on the body, I was expecting a bit more. Low to medium carbonation. Good dryness on the palate.
Overall, begins very impressive with the colour and the thick foam and everything, but after that it’s all downhill. Still, drinkable and enjoyable.

Tap at the Rose and Thistle Frimley Green. Pours a deep clear golden with quickly disappearing head. Dry malty and hoppy aroma. The taste is dry medium bitterness with soft malt with a dry crisp finish.
Bottle@home, 500ml. Head: nice white foam. Colour: clear, yellow golden. Aroma: hardly any. Taste: some bitter. Palate: watery, thin bitter finish, lively CO2. Overall: just trying

50cl Can bought in Plzen. Straight from the can. Aroma is medium-sweet, malty, light fruity, bread, light grassy. Flavour is medium-sweet, bready, hay, light grassy bitter finish with some caremel. Light-bodied. Decent.
Bottle. Clean gold pour with white head and lace. Notes of hay, honey, bitter grassy noble hops, sweet Pilsen malt. Light body on the sweet side
Bottle shared with McTapps. Decent one. Starts off with some malt and an easy going light amber colour and ends with some quafness. Nothing special, decent, average, simple, drinkable.

Clear golden colour with low head and medium body. Nose of malt. Taste of medium bitter hops, ripe grains, bitter lemon fruits, grass and malt. Easy to drink but just average. Due to its bitterness it might be really refreshing when it is warmer outside.
darker then most lagers but still same great taste crisp refreshing a good transition beer when drinking some crazier flavoured beers

Pours a clear light golden color with a decent head that fades quickly to bits of lacing. Aroma has a mild citrus aroma with some malt sweetness and grain. Taste of mild citrus, malt sweetness and grain. Mild bitterness and a fairly clean finish. Light body, crisp and quite smooth but something is missing to make this a good Bohemian Pils. Drinkable and much better than a Euro Lager.
0,5l can. Golden color. Aroma is malt and some hops. Taste is malt, grainy and hops. Medium bitterness. Very good and drinkable beer.

I didn’t finish the beer, I’ve had enough with 1/4 approx. ¿What exactly do you like of this crap guys? Maybe there was something wrong with my bottle...well, doesn’t matter because I won’t drink it again xd

50 cl bottle @ Turtola. Rated on 16.05.2009

Aroma has grassy hops, grainy malt and butter. Palate is a bit too high on CO2. Flavour has butter, grain, some grassy notes and hints of herbs. A Bohemian pils above average.

Bottle. Pours clear pale golden with airy white head. Clear aroma of hops andmalt. Bitter, hoppy flavour. Watery and a trifle unbalanced. A slight paperlike note in the finish. Could be better, but not bad as such.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur dorée-jaune et claire. Nez de grains de malt sucrés, très léger de maïs sucré avec des notes de miel, de houblon floral et herbeux (foin). Moyenne-mince en bouche et pétillante avec une texture aux notes huileuses. Goût de grains de malt pâle sucrés et croustillants  dès l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un léger goût de maïs sucré et quelques notes de miel puis finalement une légère amertume de houblon herbeux (foin) aux petites notes florales termine la gorgée. Post-goût court-moyen, légèrement amer de houblon floral aux notes herbeuses (foin).

00ml can. Brilliant pure yellow beer (Lovibond 6). Smells lightly of alcohol. Small white creamy head - mostly diminishing. Light flavours: sweet/bitter/acidic. Light to medium body. Slight metallic / alcoholic finish. Great carbonation. Generally lackluster.
Can from super market (4.7% ABV version). Golden color, white head. Malty taste with citrus, grass, toast and some sweetness. Dry malty finish with citrus. Pretty good pilsener.
Not a fan of this beer. Light appearance, mild aroma and weak flavour typical to most pilseners but slightly more unpleasant.

Tap at the Royal Oak, Windsor - 20/11/12.
Pours clear golden with a thin white head that clears to the edge and forms a light film.
Nose is malty, light fruit notes, touch peppery.
Taste comprises light hops, some honey, grain, touch of background fruit.
Medium bodied with a fair dose of carbonation, dry finish.
Average - just !

Poured clear amber with white short lasting head. Aroma basic of clean hopps with a touch of malt. Tast a simple lager with some corn, and slight honey on the back. Palate watery with medium length finish. Overall... meh.
tap. okey pilsner, a bit too week in taste and colour. Okey for co2, not too much or little. average, rather to plus side.
Botella. Poco aroma y presencia racana. Carbonatacion alta. cuerpo bajo. En boca levaduras y sequedad. Buena como caña de verano

Schöne goldgelbe Farbe mit feinporigem Schaum. Das Aroma ist verhalten grasig-hopfig. Im Antrunk sehr dünn geraten. Geschmacklich ein wenig malzig und im Abgang etwas hopfenherb, aber alles etwas zu fade geraten. Das Lager plätschert ohne bleibenden Eindruck zu lassen die Kehle herunter. Trinkbar, aber langweilig!

Can. I'don see, smell, or taste any premium about this. Just basic good lager. Without premium prize i could drink some-pack of these.
