Barely any taste, smell not much. The aftertaste disappears quickly, and unfortunately this is a boring beer to drink.

50 cl can.Creamy honey nose. Golden color with large white head with legs. Aroma cereal first, earthy after taste with butterscotch.  Taste medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate light body, thin feel, fizzy, bitter finish. Not as good as I hoped.
On tap at the Kingsdown Wine Vaults, Bristol 16/10/2012. Deep gold with no head and plenty of fizz. Easy drinking, malty lager with a moderately bitter finish. Ok.

50 cl bottle.

Originally rated on 20090215.

Pours golden color with a small head. Aroma of grass, mild hops and grain. Flavor of hay, grain and some fruit.
Bottle. Golden clear with a nice white head. Aroma of cut grass. Flavour has a little more malt to it than a lot of Pilsners. Finish has the familiar grassy hay bitterness. A fine example.

Golden colour with white head. Ordinary pale lager, but absolutely ok. Medium malty and hoppy flavour and aroma.
[Bottle from a 24H Alkohol in Warszawa, Poland]

From a 500ml bottle on 29/9/2012. Pours a clear light yellow with a biggish fluffy head. The aroma is grassy, grainy and malty. It tastes of bready and biscuity malt, with a medium hop bitterness, featuring just a touch of citrus. A way above average pale lager, which would do the trick for a session.
(Draught Olivers Bar .Rochester) Not bad .  A  bit  soulless but @ 1 am in some lame bar its pleasant.  Malt driven I would reflect,could be more hoppy n bitter.

[keg, Brown’s, Edinburgh] Pours every inch the Czech lager – crystal clear gold, large puffy white head, rising stream of bubbles. Aroma is sweet, bready and with some tangyness from the hops. Similar flavours. It’s alright, but nothing more [18082012]

Very clear, golden bodied with a nice solid white head. The same light grainy base aroma as the 10 has, maybe a bit of extra honey. Slightly more carbonation here as well, which reduced the smoothness a bit even with the added bit of alcohol. Light bitter taste, not without any character. Strangly, i even get some of the alcohol in the end. No, this isn’t great. Actualyl prefer the more drinkable 10 degree svetly.

(Flasche) Es hat eine getreidig gelbe Färbung, ist klar filtriert mit weißer Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süßlich-karamellig mit etwas Puderucker, Würze und Getreide. Der Geschmack ist ähnlich wie das Aroma etwas wässrig und mit breiter, oxidierter Bittere. Diese hängt auch unangenehm nach.

(can) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of herbal hops, light lavender, earth and a hint of marzipan, with a touch of vanilla. flavour is mostly cardboard and honey-tinged pale malts, with a slightly herbal-hoppy caramel finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle 0,5l. Bought in Bratislava. Pours a bright gold with a small white head that leaves little lacing. Musty aromas of grain, malt and hay. Flavors consisting of sweet malt, bread, caramel and some grass. Pretty highly carbonated with a slightly bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A decent effort but not very exciting. Wouldn’t bother again, but no choice means you must

I’m taking a bit of a stab at this being the beer I’ve just had at the Wheatsheaf in Felling. I remember this as being a pretty decent bottled lager sold in Wetherspoons pubs. The version I had was on draught, and came in a pint glass with a picture of the brewery engraved on the side: smacks of a relaunch. Anyway, I used to enjoy the odd bottled version of this beer, but this was dry, bland and tasteless: I will pass in future. Poor holiday lager.

Mild aroma has hay, light hoppiness. Clear golden, creamy head frothy and medium long. Taste has hay, butter, slight bitterness. Bit thin and watery, low carbonation. Quite one-sided beer. You wont find new in the next pint. Easy to drink, harder to remember.

Pours a bright gold with a small white head that leaves little lacing. Musty aromas of grain, malt and hay. Flavors consisting of sweet malt, bread, caramel and some grass. Pretty highly carbonated with a slightly bitter finish. For the style it’s nothing special but serviceable I suppose.

On keg at Browns. Pours a golden colour with a decent white head. Aroma of caramel, bready yeast and grass. Similar flavours with caramel prominent again. Moderate carbonation and CO2 prickle and a foamy mouth-feel. I prefer the Cerny from memory.
0,5l bottle. Clear golden color. Medium white head. Grainy, hay, hops in aroma. Sweet, malty, mild hoppy bitterness in flavor.

Bottle. Golden with a nice, quite durable head. Aroma is freshly cut grass, bready malt, even some basement aromas. Quite pleasant aroma, though below it’s PU counterpart. Soft taste, pleasant light to medium bitterness, some hoppy flavours. At the same time though, it is actually quite watery. Drinkable but nothing more.
Glass bottle. Golden colors, parkling liquid, minimal head, medium bitterness, medium sourness, lively carbonisation. Bitter aftertaste.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.
Pretty good beer. Nice soft grain aromas. Pours a darker golden colour. Smooth drinking..with a sweet grassy finish. Thirst quenching.
The head is robust. The taste is bitter, hoppy-grassy, metal. The aftertaste is hoppy-grassy. Ok! 11/11/10/11/10/10
Lesser by Czech pils standards, but still head and tails above other international beers in this style.

500ml can. Brilliant pure yellow beer (Lovibond 6). Smells lightly of alcohol. Small white creamy head - mostly diminishing. Light flavours: sweet/bitter/acidic. Light to medium body. Slight metallic / alcoholic finish. Great carbonation. Generally lackluster.

Originally rated August 2004. This 5.0% Czech Pilsener pours a golden colour with a good white bubbly head. The good amount of carbonation its got keeps the head alive quite some time. I smell slight malt with hints of honey. Taste starts with a mild floral bitterness, and then finishes on a nice smooth and sweet savour (while the bitter taste remains in the back of the throat). Very good refreshing Pils !
Bottle. Clear light copper color. Thin cloudy white head. Sweet malty aroma with some hops. Slightly sugary taste. Oily texture.

Can. Pours golden hale yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is soapy, strawy, some floweriness and grass. Taste is much of the same, not as soapy, more straw, tones of grass, rather non-chalant and weak. Palate is rather light.

Rating #714, bottle at easter dinner 
 


Nice golden colour with stable head. Fresh aroma with malts and hops. Flavor is likewise plus a bit alcohol. Finish is sharp and bitter saaz. Medium palate. Very refreshing and tasteful pils.

Pours bright with a nice thick foam and decent carbonation. The aroma of this beer is understated with some hops and cereal coming through. The taste has a  light to medium bitterness with a body to match. An easy session lager that does the job.
can. Golden colour, head did not last. Aroma is malty, grassy. Taste is better than expected; reasonably full malt, a little off-bitter finish. Decent.

Nice light amber colored, somewhat high on carbon gas. Good foam, good bitter taste that does not dissapeare quickly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Average pilsener, golden color, thin white head, medium bitter and sweet taste.
Pours clear gold with a thin white head. Light malt and hop taste. Not bad for a lager.
Clear golden body with a white head. Slightly bitter aroma with tea. Smooth, refreshing palate. Nice bittersweet balanced flavour. A quite nice pilsener.
Barva světlá, zlatá. Pěna bílá, střdně hustá. Vůně: sladová. Chuť: hořká, bez dozvuku, nevýrazná.

Draught at Little Prague. Pours clear and bubbly golden, fair white head. Malty aroma, crisp, malty bitterness. Long finish, light body, barbonated. Good for what it is - Czech lager that accompanies heavy greasy food.

330ml bottle pours a pale golden color with a small white head that leaves virtually no lacing.  Aroma is light grains and grassy hops.  Taste is malty sweet with a pronounced hop bitterness that was not unpleasant.  Light bodied and nicely carbonated.  This was quite an enjoyable pilsener and is recommended to sample at least once.

I det närmaste doftlös kommer denna ljusgula öl med fint vitt skum in serverat på fat på U Cerneho Vola i Prag. Däremot är det en mycket drickvänlig pilsner som är frisk och fräsch med inslag av gräs och citrus.
Golden beer with a partly stable white head. Nose is malt, hops and citruses. Body is rather light, carbon lively. Taste is bitter with sweet notes. Hops and malt on palate. B@H
Bottle and can. Pours pale gold with a quick callapsing white head. The taste is well-balanced: sweet malt with light bitterness. A decent beer for the everydays.

First off, it has to be said this beer is very - maybe dangerously - drinkable. Smooth, mouth filling malt, followed up with a gentle hop bitterness with a touch of sweetness and a touch of passionfruit at the end. Like it, maybe not as much as their dark, but a good beer nonetheless.
Pale amber with a medium white foam. Malty with fruity notes.  Malt, hops and some caramel sweetness. Medium body with a nice, balanced finish.

Enjoyed after a hard exercise, so results may be biased. Pours clear golden with a nice rocky head. Aroma buttery hops and malts. Drunk with couple of gulps to the thirst. Excellent for the occasion, Not Bad.
An average pilsener, had better of the style from Czech Republic.  A mild taste of hops but doesn’t stand out much. Tall can in Toronto

It’s by pure chance that this can happens to be kozel "premium" instead of another Kozel that I’ve already happened upon.... nonetheless I should take the opportunity to measure and test it against regular benchmarks to better understand how it fits into the broader universe of bière, per se. Nonetheless it pours with a bright yellow body and a decent head on top, slightly above average in its class. The aroma is wet farts, unshowered rock stars, in essence a bad hops schedule and far too weak to take seriously. Flavour is weak grains mixed with a heavy artificial alcohol punch and a dry cardboard finish. Well refined, but it’s lost its soul in the process and it’s not a lager with passion.
Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a fluffy white head. Aroma of malt, fresh grassy hops, light lemon. Taste is malt, grassy hops. Medium body, lively carbonation. 060811
500ml can. Golden with a fading white head. Light molasses, caramel, malts, corn, very sweet on the nose. Taste sweet (corn), high carbonation, thin, skunky, not much of a finish - worth avoiding.

Pours dark amber with a large, quickly fading head.
Nose shows hay, grassy hops and bready malt.
Flavours instead show light sweet malt with a big grainy character.
Could use more carbonation.
Pretty boring stuff.

Draught at George Hotel, Inverary. Pours golden with steady bubbles and a decent head. The nose has pale malt and some lemon. The taste has pale malt and lemon again, but there is a vegetable oil taste on the end that spoils it. The palate is light to medium-bodied and textued, with an unpleasant finish. Overall, this is disappointing for a Czech lager.

From a bottle and tap. Nice amber-golden color with a good head. 
Thick, malty, very refreshing with nice hop and malt aromas....same as taste. 
Kinda sweet for my taste, but still a good beer.

Wässriger, wenig süßer Antrunk mit kaum merkbaren Hopfenauszügen. Nur minimal aromatisch, herb, etwas plörrig bitter im Mittelteil. Zum Ende muffig. Trinkbares Bier, von dam man die Nase schnell voll hat. 6/6/6/6/7/6

Pours with a thick frothy head, large carbonation bubbles. Not much smell to me, I think it smells like a light beer. Surprising amount of flavour but no aftertaste. Very easy beer to drink a lot of and might consider doing that because of the price at LCBO.

Can. Mount Albert, Ontario, Canada.
I hear so many great things about this style of Pilsner... still haven’t had one I really enjoy. Bland skunky corn and wheat grain smell and similar taste. Gold pour. Bland, simple taste, easy drinking, sure, but not very interesting. Everyone in our tasting could "drink 10 of these!" that’s not a good sign.
Sample from can. Poured clear copper in colour with a white head. Grassy hops, malty and sweet fruity in aroma. Buttery, some sweet malty and light hoppiness in flavour.

Clear, light golden amber colour with a head that settles to a pinky sized ring around the top of the beer after starting out quite large and there is some nice lacing left on the glass.


Butterscotch and sweetness along with a touch of vanilla and basic lager hops. Not that strong a beer but a pleasant smelling one at least.


Nice, sweet malts to begin along with the butterscotch and the vanilla that featured in the nose, albeit they are a little stronger here in the taste without overpowering. There is some bitterness towards the end but nothing out of place for a lager.


Smooth with a medium body and a light, bittersweet mouthfeel that was very easy to drink.



I’d tried this before and it’s now like night and day when compared to this one. A lot sweeter and easier to drink without the skunk flavours, this one was a very nice lager that I would have again.
Decent maltiness to it, typical good quality Bohemian Pilsner, pretty good for the style, although not the very best.

Poured approx. 3/5 of a 50 cl bottle into a glass. Golden, clear beer forms a nice thick white head that decreases soon. Grassy, light malty sniff.
Taste: Some sweetness, pleasant bitterness. Palate: Light bodied beer with near average carbonation. Bitter finish. Overall: Nothing special.
pours clear copper with a decent head. surprised by this one. soft caramel malts, a hint of spice, some sweet cereals. light to medium body, average carbonation. nice.
Quite a simple beer, fairly easy drinking, nice balance of hops and soft malt. Not remarkable but a very solid lager.

Siitä onkin aikaa, kun tätä olen viimeksi maistanut. Ulkonäöltään Kozel Premium on kultainen. Päälle muodostuu valkoinen vaahto. Ensi nuuhkaisu tuo nenään jotain ikävän virtsamaista. Tuo tuoksu saattoi johtua vaahdosta ja haju häviääkin johonkin taustalle vaahdon katoamisen myötä. MuutenTuoksultaan olut on hedelmäinen, diasetyylinen, maltainen ja ruohoisen humaloitu. Maultaan se on voinen, maltainen ja kevyesti humalainen. Hieman tunkkaistuutta oluesta löytyy. Mieluummin juon niitä muita Kozeleita, mutta on tämäkin ihan juotavaa.

500ml can sample, poured into a pint glass. Pours a clear golden yellow, with a huge pillowy white head. Really decent lacing. Not much to say about the aroma. The taste is pretty simple, it’s of hops and a little sweet malt. Nothing too complex.
Quite good lager, nothing really special but still quite enjoyable. Nice bitterness in aftertaste.

Appearance: Golden orange, clear. Some off-white head.
Aroma: Hops and a bit of sweetish malt.
Taste: Sweetness and some bitterness. Nothing special.
Info: 500ml bottle, 2/11-2010
Pretty standard tasting beer. Pours golden color and tastes a little sweet. Nothing special and nothing bad. But I wouldnt go out of my way to have another one. If I saw one I might pick it up

Nice pale gold, a snowy white head that unfortunately dissapears quickly. Aromas of malt, some hops, the taste is malty, not in a bad way, but I would’ve expected more hops from a Bohemian. So it’s OK, not great.
Cannette 500 ml. 5%. Couleur or, mousse blanche. Arômes de malt. En bouche, rafraîchissante, goût de céréale et un peu de houblon. Pils Tchèque classique.
bottle. very common beer in the czech republic. nothing fancy, drinkable but not great.
Had in Prague. Pleasant Czech lager. Malty sweetness. Prefer the dark  Serving: Tap

A - Floral and citrus
A - Clear and golden with a thick white head
T - Dry, bitter and almost sour with a slight sweet finish
P - Medium to light body with soft carbonation
O - A very nice lager. Well put together
On tap, bottle, can. Golden color, nice white head. Aroma, hoppy, fruity, grain. Taste, hop, in start sweet with light bitter finish.
Sampled along side other pilsners from cans. I remember this being very bold, yet only slight bitterness. I didn’t taste a lot of saaz.

Bottle. Golden body with a nice but disappearing head. The taste is malty sweet with not enough hops and bitterness. I would have guessed it’s just a pale lager not a Bohemian pilsner. I was underwhelmed.

Draft in Budapest, Hungary. Pretty decent fare for a lager even if it’s pretty typical. Golden pour with a white head. Nose is herbal with grains and moss, and rainwater. Taste is clean and crisp with grain, herbal notes, and some bitters. decent.

500mL Can on my neverending journey at the LCBO. Not gonna lie to you, I love the fact that there is a goat on this can. Like really. The beer has to be decent if you’re going to put a goat on there. Not many people really want to associate their brews with barnyard animals, but if they do, its gotta be good, right? 

Clear golden pour with a bubbly white head. Aroma has a hint of malty sweetness, and a bold, hoppy aroma. Medium carbonation. Bubbly, dry mouthfeel. Taste is quite bitter, a full blast of Saaz hops layered with the malty sweetness. Finish is smooth. An excellent pilsener.

500ml can.  Pours a light amber with a white head.  Aroma is grain, apple juice, straw, faint hops.  Smells like a Euro pilsener.  Taste is clean, malt, hops.  Exactly as advertised.  Solid warm weather option.

Bottle. Pours a nice golden straw, crystal clear with a great creamy white head. Typical pilsner type aromas. Faint biscuity malt and plenty of herbacious hops. A little hop resiny is also apparent. Good nose on this one. Flavours are similar to the nose with nice hop bitterness near the finish. Yeast character is definately more pronounced in taste as apposed to aroma. Not too bad.

500ml bottle - West Gate Inn (JDW), Canterbury. Poured a dark yellow with a lasting & lacing small white head with plenty of body carbonation. Grain, straw and bready, biscuity malts. The biscuity malts come through on the tongue accompanied by some toastiness and a dull hoppy bitterness in the finish. Light body, medium to full carbonation with a short bitter finish, a crisp mouthfeel and sweet aftertaste.

Canette de 500 ml.  Bière blonde coiffée d’une mousse blanche.  Le nez trouve du maïs, du miel et des houblons floraux.  Les saveurs sont les mêmes mais avec une accentuation au niveau des grains maltés.  Le liquide est assez pétillant en bouche et nous donne une finale aussi discrète qu’agréable sur des notes amères.  En résumé, reste tout de même une bonne pilsener.
Can. Pours golden amber colour with a creamy head.  Aromas of light malt, and floral hops.  Taste is similar with hints of barley and bitter hops on the finish.  Pleasantly surprised by this one.
500ml. Clear pale pilsner yellow. Head dosen’t last long. Malt, honey & grassy hop aroma. Slight bitterness in taste more than malt. Not to bad though not my style.

50cl can. Poured clear light amber color, with a medium white head. 
Aroma is malt and hint of fruits.  Flavour is strong of malt and some hoppy notes, slightly bitter finish. I´ve had better pilseners, still OK.

.5l draft at Silenus in Budapest. Deep golden honey with creamy head. Grassy, malty nose with touch of whey and honey. Lots of flavor for such a light abv beer. Very balanced and rounded before wet sour-lager finish. Just a touch of bitter.

0.5 l bottle as a gift from Slovakia.
If I’m not wrong, the label says that it brewed in Topolcany/Slovakia by licence.
Pours a golden colour with a medium head and average carbonation.
Watery/light smell of grain and hops, the taste is sweetsour, flavour’s bready.
Cereal, grassy, yeasty aroma, the finish is bitter and dry.
The body"s medium, texture’s a bit thin.
Not a cogent stuff...
Yellow with a dense head. Nice floral hoppines in the aroma with further notes of grass and corn. The flavour is nicely balanced between a good malt profile and a long lasting bitter finish.

Bottle 500ml. This is not too far from the standard pale lagers. Aroma has band-aid, and straw. Taste is sweet, with some balancing bitterness. Palate is oily, and it has a light body with high carbonation. Dark yellow, with quite a big frothy head.

A great pilsener from the czechs. Typical Kozel taste with lots of bitterness. A bit malty taste, sparkling body, soft carbonation, and long dry, bitter aftertaste Juicy and smooth. It ’s so simple making fine beers. Calming beer, i recommend drink it before bedtime, you’ ll have nice dreams.

500ml can thanks to Robin

Appearance : Clear yellow, medium head. Not much of it stays for too long.


Aroma : Very malty and a bit citrusy. Not so much fruity. Not bad but I’ve had much better.
 

Taste : Very malty, and a bit citrusy and hoppy. Finish is lightly bitter and hoppy. 


Overall : Taste is quite discrete but it is not bad at all. Very refreshing and very highly drinkable. Nothing bad to say about it only that it is a bit dull maybe. Still a good pils fix !
Golden color, white head; malty aroma is also fruity; medium body, very crisp mouthfeel; flavor of sweet malts with fruity hoppy finish.
500ml bottle. Gold, white head. Kind of muddy malts and subdued floral hops. No particular character, but by the numbers Czech Pils is still OK.
Bottle@WetherspoonsWembley. Light grainy aroma. Pale golden colour, white head, good lace. Sweetish, light bitter lager. Refreshing, easy going.

50cl bottle.
Deep golden body, white foam.
Clean, crisp, nice hint of floral hops with a firm bitterness to finish.
One of the better Czech pils i’ve come across.

500mL can from LCBO. Not a bad pilsener, but not my favourite by far.  Pours golden with a lasting white head. Nose is honey with some grass. Creamy body, malty sweetness, with some light hops. Clean finish.

[500ml bottle at the Back of Beyond, Reading] Deep gold with a large, off-white head.  Moderate carbonation - the bubbles somehow got up my nose and felt quite uncomfortable!  Has a lovely deep malty aroma and flavour - of Horlicks and malted milk biscuits rather than beer malt.  Despite the mellow malt, there were enough hops to my the beer very crisp and refreshing, with a citrus tang in the aftertaste.  Possibly the best golden lager I’ve ever had.
fine hop aroma, golden, clear, white foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, long finish, bitter, average carbonation, average lager beer
Cheap drinking, but of a reasonable standard. Smooth malt body with a slightly floral finish. Extra points for low price. Would drink again.

Can (6-pack) brought from our Czeck collegue. 
Quite good if you ar thirsty. A bit like he rest of the gang!
500 ml bottle - Clear gold. White head. Medium to high carbonation. Thin to medium body. Malty with floral hop flavours. Moderately bitter finish.

500 ml can from LCBO.  Pours a clear gold with a good-sized frothy, white head.  Grass and a slight hint of corn in the nose.  Sweet fruity flavour with biscuit and grass.  Crisp finish; fine carbonation.  Not bad, although the aroma really threw me.

500ml can. Poured clear amber with a fizzy white head. Metallic corn aroma. Light mouthfeel, lively carbonation, sticky bitter finish. Light malts, bready flavour and fairly dry, sticky bitter finish. Leaves a warming feeling in the back of the mouth.
500 ml can from LCBO.  Pours golden in colour with small amount of white head.  Aroma is mild, flavour is slightly bitter.   Average.  Drinkable.
bottle 0.5 l got it from a friend. golden liquid medium head. it’s sticky sweet, in a bad way. mild bitter in an ok way. overall not very refreshing...

0.5L bottle, Big head, dark golden colour, aromas of herbs, vanila and biscuit, light malty sweetness with a strong and dominant bitterness, medium to big body, sour bitter aftertaste, typical solid Bohemian pilsener.

Bottled from Velky Meder. Typical dark golden Czech pils color, average but dense head, inspiring malty nose. Aroma is sweet caramel, malts and soft hops. Harsh chnage for the bitter and dry end. Nice!

roasty, woody, lightly bitter, heavily sour, average carbonation, medium body, 
Not bad to try, but wouldn’t drink it again. Wouldn’t suggest drinking this beer without food to go with it.
500ml Bottle - Golden with a white head. Malty and grainy aroma with a hint of weetabix. Slightly sweet and malty taste with a light bitterness. Drinkable, but nothing to get too excited about.

I tried this one immediately following a Zlaty Golden Pheasant, and found it in every way to be maybe just one notch less in every category but for the colour.  Aroma was almost nil, but at least taste, mouthfeel and aftertaste were acceptable, just not as good as the bird.
Draught at "Little Prague", bright yellow with nice white head, aroma of herbs acid, olives and notes of flowers, grainy flavors with some herbs and bitter finish, quite watery, medium quality pils.

Sampled in Prague. A pretty good brew. Got to love the goat. Color is golden with a pretty good thick head. Aroma is semisweet. Palate is pretty crisp with not to much carbonation. A pretty good brew.
Not served at it ideal temperature. Typical lager beer in aroma and appearance. Refreshing but but quite rich.

500 ml can from LCBO, served cool in a tulip glass. 



App.:  Deep golden, clean, remnants of a white froth.
  
Aroma:  Corn, grain, adjunct, faint fruitiness and a touch of grassy hops, a little vegetal.
  
Palate:  Medium body and carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Much like the nose with plenty of grain and cereal, slightly fruitier and slightly more grassy hops; dry with a little bitterness.



Meh.

(Sample Date: 3/8/2009   Source:Other)   Richmond Beer Dig. Light graininess with some honey notes. Clear light straw with a small white head. Lightly spicy hop over light caramel and honey. Light body with a fizzy mouth feel. Medium finish with spicy peppery hop bitterness.

Draught at some cafe on Bat-Yam’s promenade for a ridiculous price of 29 Shekel (more than 7$) for 0.3L. Clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma of bready malt, light graininess and a bit of noble hops. Sweetish bready flavor with grainy notes that continues bitter and grassy. Light-medium body.

[2056-20090329] 500mL can. Sweet powdery corn aroma. Clear, pale light yellow body that pours a big foamy white head and lattice lacing. Sweet cornbread yeast flavour. Light body seems a little dusty on the tongue. Poor.

Bottle, 4.8%. Clear dark golden colour. Stable white head. The flavour starts off with a slightly rough bitterness. Turns a little malty, light malts of course. Faint hint of aroma hops in the aftertaste. Quite clean, but also a little watery.

Bottle. Poured pale amber or deep straw with a short-lived slight white head. A somewhat malty aroma. Light body with moderate carbonation. A promising initial pilsner taste passes through a somewhat metallic bitter phase to a very disappointing watery finish. Overall disappointing.

500ml can

Fizzy pissy look, not exactly unexpected. Plasticky lager aroma. Dull dull dull lagery taste. No nasty, but devoid of anything interesting.

500 mL Can. Clear yellow with a frothy 2-finger white head that settles but seems to have some staying power, leaving good lacing. Aroma is sweet malt with a nuttiness and grassiness about it with a floral note. Flavor is sweet nutty malt with a grassy-nutty hop aftertaste and a nutty-bitter hop finish. Not too shabby.

On tap at U Cerneho Vola, Prague.
Pours deep golden with a large sized creamy head. Hop aroma, taste is sweet malts and hops.

Can at the Seventh Annual Richmond Beer Dig on 03/08/2009. Clear pale golden body with an off white head. Light sweet honey and grain aroma. Semi sweet honey and grain flavor. Medium body with moderately high carbonation.
bottle, pours gold, tall frothy white head.  Spicy malt and light alcohol aroma.  Low carbonation brings a full bodied sweet malt and a citrusy hop finish.  Good.
500 ml bottle. Golden yellow colour, thin white head. Simple malty aroma with a whiff of hops. The flavour is mild, malty with a hint of hoppy bitterness in the finish. Neutral and uninteresting.
500ml bottle. Light golden, clear with a small head. A sence of malt and some hops, a little bitter at the end. Bit Watery

it smells like the odour they put in hairdye, but only lightly, and that isnt a bad thing... also a bit of malt. its gold with a lasting head, the taste is of popcorn and light hops. the mouthfeel is unusual, it feels syrupy and sticky but smooth. this is an unusual beer, and the hairdye smell is still noticeable as i am drinking it... just odd, not necessarily bad but i dont think i will bother with this again..
Bitter taste is very nice.  Although tastes like most eastern europe brings.
500ml can: big white head.  Welcoming aroma of floral hops.  Tastes sweet-malty with shades of caramel; smoothe.  Bitter finish. Sturdy lager.

500ml bottle. It has a clear, dark golden hue, with quite a small head. Initially it is strongly carbonated, but it doesn’t last long. It is reasonably bitter, yet there is a slightly odd aftertaste that does it no favours. It is merely an average beer.
White head diminishes fast. Light lager color. Aroma of malts and hops. Smooth palate. Flavors of sweet malts and hops, citrus.  semi-bitter end.

Golden body, nice medium white head. Moderated aroma of floral hop, fine malt, some sourish yeast, balanced perfume. Smooth mouthfeel, balanced flavor of  malt, light bottom-yeast, fine hop. Not a big character but a very drinkable lager stuff. Why the brewery Dreher brews the Kozel 10? This is a better one...
Sötétebb sárga szín,közepes de tartós hab és virágos komlós illat a jellemzői.Ízében érezni a malátát is,amit kellemes keserédes utóíz követ.Ez egy kellemes asztali sör a mindennapokra.

500ml bottle from Dan Murphy’s. A clear dark yellow beer with a loose transient white head. Malt driven aromas with a hint of flowery hops and brine. Flavour is mainly sweet malts with a hint of vanilla to the finish. Hardly any bitterness in there. Watery mouthfeel. More like a bland lager than a Bohemian pilsner.

0.5 l can Doggythedog shared with me, thanks! It poured golden body with medium sized head. Weaker aroma, malty honey and flowery, quite boring, of a typical mass produced beer. Flavor was a bit light but relatively well rounded with malty sweetness and much smaller amount of some herbal hops. It had sweetish finish as well, with that bitterness remaining to its very end. Not quite good beer for Czech standards, but also it was not bad.

0.5l can courtesy of a friend who brought it from Prague (thanks Mislav!). Poured a fine golden colour with some lazy carbonation and a medium sized white head. Malty, honeyish nose with a touch of veggies. The taste isn’t all that special but it’s nice ’nuff. Sweetish maltiness, a bit bready, dominates the taste, with some low, but chewy hoppiness (veggy/herbal). A fine, balanced pils that I kinda liked but that is nowhere near the best that the Czech Republic offers.
Bottle. A decent lager, though there’s better Czech pilsners. Nice maltiness with some sweet figs and a decent bitter finish.

Bottle. A clear, golden beer with a medium sized off-white head. Malty sweet nose with some fruityness and a touch of cooked vegetables. Fruity-sweet and matly flavor with some cooked vegetalbes. Decent bitterness too, but could use more. Medium body. Fruity and bitter finish. A decent beer, but far from impressing. (081022)
Deep golden with a diminishing white head. Caramel malt and fruity notes. Flavour is sweet malt and hops. Smooth bitter finish.

Bottled. Golden coloured and sparkling beer with medium-sized, long lastin white head. Aroma has bready and slightly toffy malts. Hops are sharpish and grassy. Some fruitiness is present in the finish. Flavor is quite bready, a bit grainy and also slightly buttery in the finish. This is quite sweet, actually. Medium bitterness but a good hoppy bite is missing. Palate is medium bodied, smooth bitterish sticky in the finish. Quite an ok and malty pils but I´d like to find more hops in it.

50cl bottle at home. Clear yellow, fine white head. aroma of  slight banana, alc,acrohops, 

flavor is sweet and a little malty, faint tones of banana or other sweet fruits or sugar. bitterness balances sweetness well.

Golden bronze in color with a fine head.  Doughy malts, light caramel malt, as well as a bit of hops in the nose.  Flavor is mroe caramel malts with nice biscuit as well.  Light hops that I wish were a little more intense.  Decent and enjoyable.


&#40;Draught at Pivovar Yokohama&#41;
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is sweet, fruit, malt, hop. Flavour is sweet, malt, hop, apple. OK beer.
500ml bottle.Sparkling orange in colour this beer poured with a creamy white head that seemd to last forever. Medium body with not a lot of carbonation.
50 cl bottle at Skallerup Klit. Clear golden color, disappering white head. Aroma is grassy malt and hops. Flavor is sweet with fine malt and hops, ending with a fine bitterness. Nice pilsener.
canette de 500ml, bière blonde belle mousse, agréable, nez houblonnée, bouche piquante agréable,

(bottle)  Somewhat flatly carbonated, pale straw coloured Pilsener.  Upon opening, a nice malty aroma.  Soft mouthfeel with a somewhat coarse bitterness.  Granted it was too warm when I tasted it, I had to try this beer, but probably won’t seek it out again.
Amber beer with frothy head. Well carbonated with hops, caramel and a malty finish. Nice.
Clear golden with tiny white head. Sweet fruity aroma with malty notes and hints of caramel. Flavour likewise with hints of cardboard.

Oh my word. This may be my favorite Pilsner. I always have this when I’m in the Czech Republic (and when it’s available). Everything a good Pilsner needs to be: refreshing, bubbly, abundantly hoppy. Mind you it’s based on my impression of a few years ago.

Draft at U cerného vola, Prague. Large rocky white diminishing head with good lacing. Clear yellow body. Malt aroma of grain, hay and straw, distinct bitter aroma. It has a light body, thin texture average carbonation and a bitter finish. The flavor is light sweet and moderate bitter.

...bottle.   Sparkeling light orange with a minimul head.  Hops on the nose, with freshly cut grass.  Had a decent flavor, with sweet, lightly roasted malts.  Light bodied, easy drinking. Finish was dry and slightly bitter, with some hop notes.  Not bad at all.

Bottle 50cl.
Clear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lancing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light metallic. (270508)

(Draught at U Cerneho Vola, Prague, 23 July 2008) Golden yellow colour with a frothy, white head. Malty, grassy nose with notes of tropical fruit. Malty, grassy taste with bread, pineapple and a short, citrussy finish. Fairly thin, too sweet. Yawn!
A reasonably good tasting Czech pilsener, worthy of a taste now and again.  Head fizzles away quickly, yet a refreshing taste.
Another absolutely excellent Pilsner from the Czechs. They seem to be the only country consistently up to par with the Germans on this style. Well done, excellent beer and deserves the rating it has.

Bottle from some new bar in town, this was the only thing I’ve not had in there and probably will go for something different next time. typical malty pils which isn’t really my thing. I found it watery and a little metallic. Didn’t care for this much.

500ml can thanks to Jeff Jones. This was on a higher league than most lagers I have had. Taste was slightly sweet with small hits of malt. The aroma of mild hops was pleasing and it drank quite well, and smooth. No bitterness to the flavour, which is better left out of a beer that isn’t paid a lot of attention to in the brewing process. Not a bad lager. I’d take this over Creemore.

Rated: 29.07.2007

Bottle brown, 500 ml, 12 P

Appearance: Head is small than decreases and diminishes almost at all, what lasts is only a small rim around the glass wall. Head colour was white but after a few seconds there is totally nothing. Body is sparkling in a normal way, very clear, light amber in colour.

Aroma: Rather simple, chalky mainly, a hint but very small hint of alcohol, a bit sweet from malted barley, some hints of hoppyness, rather very poor aroma compared with other Bohemian Pilseners from Czech Republic and Slovakia.

Flavour: Surprisingly I am disappointed, Kozel made of beer is after drinking 3 types of it 10 P, 12 P and Cerny, the worst mark of Bohemian Pilseners I’ve ever tasted. Like poor Polish Pale Lagers from supermarkets. I think it’ s really the great art of brewing to make such a wattery beer - plonk out of such a good ingredients used there and natural sources in the country. Beer seems more wattery than 10 P version and has considerably worst taste, nothing more. Finish duration is short. 

Palate: Rather no aftertaste, body is light, texture is wattery, carbonation is soft on palate, finish feel is wattery and accidic, total failure.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear and almost golden yellow with a semi creamy and white head. Light caramel malt aroma. Flavour shows a smooth malt base with a minor note of caramel. Light fresh bitterness lurking through in the finish. Nice and smooth brew.
Actually liked Kozel Svetle more. This has more complex flavour, but (at least my bottle) is much heavier, a bit too heavy for a pils. Slightly acidic. Solid though.

Clear golden color with big, creamy and lacy white head. Mild and smooth malty aroma, also some grassy hoppyness and butter. Mild, malty flavor is slightly buttery and balanced with smoothly bitter hops. Medium-bodied, smoothly carbonated palate is not watery at all.
50cl bottle. Pours yellow with a creamy egg white head & lacings. Aroma & taste is of hay/grass & hops. Very fresh, floral & crisp. Medium bodied. Nice pilsener!

500 ml can.  Pours a glorious gold, with medium head.  Odour reminded me of Old Milwaukee - i.e., it smelled cheap.  Found the malty/tinny taste to be reminiscent of mass produced US beer.  Quite a disappointment

The Beer Store - Can: Light golden colour, small but present head. A kind of almost borderline fruit aroma with some grassy hops too. This has an unusual taste, fruit and malt with a grassy finish, there is a slight metallic twang in there too

Deep clear golden with quickly disappearing lacy head. Dry bohemian hops aroma. The flavor flavor is well-balanced, buttery, the malts are very fruity (apple-ish) and the hops are teasing, zesty and pure. Soft carbonation and medium body lead to dry, buttery finish.
500mL can from the LCBO.  A very good Czech pilsner.  More hopped than Pilsner Urquell, and a touch more malty than Czechvar/Budvar.  Excellent.

Bottle. High fluffy and quickly disappearing white head. Clear golden body. Lovely strong and distinct barley malt aroma. Flavor is also very barley malt dominated which I like.Maybe I could have had a bit more bitterness.  Low carbonation Long and reletively sweet aftertaste.

LCBO 500ml can, I thought it was as good as the freshest bottle of Kozel I can ever remember - perhaps even better with a rounded smoothness. It had an almost fruity malt character & the kind of svelte, sexy hops I really enjoy in this style of beer, rendering Kozel Insane drinkability, good flavour and being just exactly what it should be.

Bottle at ’Spoons, Milton Keynes. Gold, large white head. Yeasty aroma. Sweet, gentle taste. Smooth, oily mouthfeel. Little bitterness. Very easy drinking. This is popular with the younger generation, who seem to prefer it to cask ales.

Golden with a small but creamy head. The aroma has pleasantly malty notes and so does the slightly sweet flavour, that also has notes of caramel and floral hops. The bitterness isn’t very pronounced, but it’s refreshing.

Perfectly clear golden pour with way too much bubbly white head.  Scent of hops, grass, and a touch of malts.  Taste is oily, sticks to the tonge.  A lot of hops, some nuts, quite a bit of bitterness.  Not very easy drinking due to the thickness of the taste.  The bitterness lingers far too long.  To me this is just another generic Euro Pils though near the top of the list for Euro Pils crap.

This is a lovely tasting beer, pours a carbonating perfect  gold colour,medium head aroma is malty and fresh,slight nut like.Flavour though slightly metallic is good bitter lovely hops and a refreshing fruity taste with a dry finish that is thirst quenching,

Bottle.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Aroma of malts, caramel and fruits with notes of hops.
Flavour of malts, fruits and caramel with notes of hops.

Can. Gold with an intriguing red/brown infusion. Sugar-water nose is actually misleading, as the flavour boasts a decidedly bitter flavour. Nice refreshment-factor and clean palate. A good, though basic, summertime lager.
0,5L can. Strong malty aroma. Golden color with white head. Hoppy bitter flavor, but feel metallic taste of can. Strong long aftertaste.

Draught @ Black Bull, Hradcany.  Light gold w/ impressive head, mild fruity nose, sweet candy body, very smooth and quaffable, light finish, barest herbal bitterness in finish.  Rather refreshing after a long hike up the hill.
Draught. Sweet grassy nose. Clear golden with a big head leaving some serious lacing. Very assertive flavor, dry but clean straw/malt taste. Really nice palate, sharp but not abrasive.

0.5l can. Pours a hazy golden brown with a small, persistent head. Lots of carbonation. Faint aroma - smells like a pilsener. Light palate, very smooth, but very fizzy. Initial taste is very bitter. Quickly becomes more flavourful. One of the better pilseners I have tried.

A fizzy budwesier. Notes of minerals and cardboard. I couldn’t finish this one.
500 ml can. pours yellow with an ave white head. aromas are citris, malt and weak hop. very well balanced but to thin to be great. doesnt seem very pilnerish. enjoyable in quantity.
Bottle. Clear gold. Creamy head. Mild aroma of apples, hops and malt. Interesting taste, grassy and hints of dried fruit. Well balanced. Body is light. Good beer.
nice golden lager, decent foam, hops and stale malt on the nose, good in between pilsner not to hoppy but not bland.

500ml can from the LCBO.
Nice bready, hoppy, malty aroma. Flavour is crisp, and malty. Wow, this really is a decent pils. Nice stuff!
Nice crips hop boquet, small white head, crisp Sazz flavor on a medium to light mouth feel with a fair amount of bitterness.

500ml can Pours out a very nice dark gold, crystal clear. Head is frothy and recedes to good lacing. The hops are quite up front on this one, and it stays faithful to the Pilsener style. Not something I could drink all the time, but a solid beer.
Nice golden colour with a mild Saaz hoppy aroma.  Slight sweetness, overall decent pilsner.  Nice body, better than the "regular" mass produced lagers

aroma is considerably good, very good notes of malt and fruit, delicate but distinctive, flavour is very good, balanced, not another artifficailly flavoured macro. light and very drinbkable, medium to full bodied, , it is sth more than regular czech lager

The has a bright golden body capped by a tall, bubbly off-white head.  The aroma has a metallic sweetness followed by damp grasses and herbs.  The flavor begins with a nicely rounded bready maltiness, but it’s a bit too sweet without enough hops to make it much of a Pilsener as it’s listed.  A lemony tartness is added to the mild, mild hop bitterness in the finish.

From my artist buddy, frankenkitty.

Pours mid-golden with faint effervescence under a full and holding eggshell-white head. Mild catty/eggy aromas fade to herbals over wheat and low metallics. Saaz hops with background sweetness and low cardboard flavor. Bitterness lingers but there is a mild cloy in the chalky finish. Hints of lemon and more metallica. Messy.


Single can from a "The Beer Store", London, ON, CAN
Yeah, a good pilsner.  Quite tangy, though not quite as quaffable as Urquell or Star, which are better session beers.
On tap in a beach bar in Jurmala, Latvia. Golden colour, moderate head. Distinctly malty aroma and flavour with notes of butterscotch (diacetyl). Moderate hops in the finish.
clear golden with a thin layer of white head, kozel has some czech pils aroma. the brew is fruity but clean.
Bottle.  Pours a somewhat cloudy golden color with a nice aroma of malt and slight hop.  Taste is slightly heavy, nice malt and nutty characteristics.  A very solid pilsner, I enjoyed this.

I tried this beer on July 1, 2007 after purchasing at my local LCBO store.  It poured a somwehat cloudy gold colour, not translucent.  The aroma was strong and malty with some grainy tones.  It is slightly thick on the tongue with very little carbonation.  The taste is slightly malty with a toasty aftertaste.  This is another Czech beer I would have no problem trying again.
bottle. Golden yellow, large head, malty nose. Very malty flavour, slightly hoppy with hints of bread and grain, hoppy finish.

Bottled. A golden beer with a nice cream colored head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of hops, but also notes of caramel - very inviting. The flavor is sweet malty with strong notes of hops and caramel, the mouthfeel is very crisp. Towards the end the hops gives it a note of straw to go along with the long lasting bitter finish.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour with medium white mostly diminishing head. Hoppy aroma with hints of grain. Sweet bitter flavor.

Yet another tasty pilsner to add to my list of bohemian’s! This one had a little bit more of an alcohol taste to it, but still had a good bitter finish with some well-balanced sweet malts in their too. Aroma was more of crisp pils malts, very enticing. Flavour has nice Saaz bite in the finish, riding on a delicious pils malt body. Body has a rough edge to it, probably from harder water used (kind of reminds me of Grand River’s Galt Knife lager). Very well rounded, very good on a hot day. Awesome. I could drink boatloads.

Canned.  Pale golden, brief head. Light hay aroma. Sweet with clean hard mouthfeel, faint hay flavour, quick bitter finish. What used to be a fine beer full of character has been turned into a dull industrial lager by the modernizations of the brewery.

500ml can. Pours a pale golden colour with a nice fluffy head that diminished quickly. Aroma is hops, malt , grains, grass/hay and some mild fruity notes. Flavor of grains, mild malt and hops. Dry and crisp with a nice moderately bitter finish that is not overwhelming. A decent Czech pils, but nit still dosent live up to Urquell.
Can, 50 cl. Deep, clear golden, medium white head. Generous malt aroma, slightly roasted, and lots of floral hops. Medium bodied, and very soft mouthfeel. Nice and long bitterness.

Bottle. Average fizzy white head that mostly diminished. Spare lacing. Clear light sparkling body with a slightly golden colour. Sweet malt with good Czech hoppy bitter notes in the bouquet. What hits the mouth was a lovely dry crisp bitterness. I always have the feeling of a somewhat dusty experience with Czech Pilsner, and that is meant in a good way. Light to medium bodied with an average carbonation. Flavour was light malty with solid bitterness to balance the beer. Finish was slightly sweet and light dry.

Holy bitch tits mc clue!  I remember the day wetherspoon brought this into thier range and its stayed perhaps longer than most of thier other "wolrd beers". Aroma is lager malts and caramel touch of grassy hops. Taste is similar carbonation is reasonable, fairly easy to drink but unexcitable.
Very pale yellow in colour, light lager hop, with a malty lagery flavour.its bit average

Very mild premium pale lager.  I do like the brewery but prefer their darks.  This sample was overly mild for my pallate.  This exhibited a mild malt taste with a similar aroma.  The mouth feel was similar to a czech pils.
not good.  bland taste.  fizzy.  from a can so no way for it to be bothered by the light.  weird.

541 ml can: This is among the finest lagers I’ve ever had. It pours a nice golden colour with little head and a hint of carbonation. A fruity, honey aroma greets the nostrils and gives the brain the first hint of the pleasurable experience about to follow. This beer is very refreshing and initially light on the palate but finishes with just the right amount of bitterness. I could drink vats of this stuff. Once again the Czechs prove that they are one of the best beer nations in the world. Well done!
Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate hopy surprisingly fruity aroma. Light bitter/sweet flavor, moderate bitter finish. Average duration. Oily palate.

Can. Pours a pale golden color with a big longlasting white head. Sweet malty grainy aroma with some hints of hops. Sweet malty grainy and slightly grassy flavor. Thick mouthfeel with a sweet malty finish with some bitterness in the aftertaste.
Sweet, gassy, grainy, gently Saaz hoppy and exactly like any one of a million other interchangeable generic continental ’Pilseners’. Zzzzzz.
One of the best beers for BBQ. Cheap, tasty with a great hoppy aroma. My favourite :)

A Mes rate: 
50cl bottle from Baker Street ’Spoons. Lots of malt weak on flavour. Gassy and straight forward lager.
A nother great Czech beer yellow with small head tast is malty and  easy to drink.Dry finish.

Bottle. Light golden colour with rather small short lasting white head. Aroma of fruity hops and malts, bit grassy.Flavour is a bit sweet with some fruitiness, plenty of hops and some malts. Bitter finish.

500mL can:  Detected tinge of camembert cheese in the aroma (unexpectedly pleasant) with slight hops presence.  Nice thin head of one finger that leaves behind slight lacing on a clear, dark yellow body.    Flavor has the same cheeziness to it.  Very nice.  Thick malted barley and subdued hops with a unusual smooth finish.  Carbonated yet well balanced mouthfeel.  I was expecting this beer to be your average imported crap, but was pleasantly surprised all the way through.  I have to admit that the Czechs know how to brew great beer!
Bottle. Yellow and fizzy. White head. Wet grass, hops, a touch of alcohol. Gassy and slightly grassy. Sweet and refreshing palate though. For the refreshing aspect, it’s an OK beer.
Actually pretty good. I had this at a few places in SK, and my brother-in-law was more than happy to give me a bottle before I even looked thirsty.

500 mL can:  This typical European Lager took me by surprise. I was already to defend the pale lager/pilsner from Rate Beer snobs, but this beer actually has a good reputation on this site! Deep golden colour, thin head. Crisp, clean, smooth, no aftertaste but some subtle hops, not alot of hops bite at all.  C’mon! Don’t knock this beer, it serves its function quite well & it has some things going for it, for sure.

Available in road tankers,a primo CZ

export bottles,buy in boxed cases.

A well rounded smooth pilsner which was a must have for any serious hitch hiker walking backwards thru the Czech and Slovak republics.  Not overly hopped and worthy of anyones hunt for it.

Bottle. Pours golden with a fast-disappearing white head. Sweetish aroma. Dryish cereal notes. Sweetish flavour. Some bitterness. Cereal and watery notes. Dryish finish with hoppy and grassy notes. Milky notes appear as it warms. 05-12-06.
Clear and yellow. Has a white, lasting head. Has no special bitter-hoppy in the aroma, well, it has no special aroma. Flavor is mainly kind a sweet with flour-notes.
I was pleased with this beer, since I was not expecting much. Golden color with a white head. Malty aroma. Pilsner style.

Bottled: Aroma with a light malty base, light herbal hoppy. Dark golden color with frothy head. Quite malty, light sweet flavor, light citrus notes, light grassy hop notes. Finish is dry and medium bitter. Well balanced, pleasant mixture of malt and hop.
Bottled. Clear golden in colour with a fluffy white head, lacings. The aroma is malty. The flavour is malty and somewhat hoppy and grassy. It has a very pleasant aftertaste.
500 ml. bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is malty as well as flavour with a bitter hoppy finish.

Thin creamy head. Classic golden / tan in colour (as expected). Nose very typical of the Eastern Euro pilsner style with earth (and perhaps slightly stale?) malts. Bottle in Czech. Pretty decent pilsener, nice and smooth, perfect for downing in a Czech penzion.

Bottle: Very refreshing beer. I liked the hoppy aroma. Goes down smooth and - like a good pilsener - leaves a nice bitterness behind on the tongue. A good solid beer. I missed some color of the beer but ok for a pilsner.
50 cl can Fine grassy hoppiness, and quite full fllavour from the malt. ’a good pilsener, though the competition is fierce.

Nice fresh malty and fruity aroma with not as much hops in the aroma as expected. Nice nevertheless. Clear golden colour. White head that dissapears fast. Taste is more malty then other czez beers, and not as hoppy as most. Pleasent but a little dull.

Can: Poured a yellowish color pilsner with a big white foamy head with good retention. Aroma of what seems like corn and adjunct is quite surprising since I didn’t though Czech brewery were using those ingredient. Taste is also bland with very little malt and no hops at all. Overall, I was quite disappointed with this one and was expecting closer to Pilsner Urquell then this.
500 ml can. Mild aroma, golden colour, pleasant hoppy flavour and smooth finish on the palate. One of my faves.

Love the color and head, they sure look inviting! The fruity bitterness of the hops
persist in your mouth, but lacks complexity. The perfect beer for a picnic.
Grassy and hoppy, but fades fast. A bit more malt character than some pilseners. Undemanding but very refreshing.

Golden color, bigg foamy head. brilliant pilsener,...a perfect balance in any way. I would trink thise every day if I wase a czech ore slowak
Aroma is sweet like paint. Very sweet and not bitter pils. This is an easy drinking beer in a typical Bohemian style.

On our vacation in the Czech Republic, Nejdek, I bought this in a supermarket. 
It tasts good.

I found this in an American liquor store which was a pleasant surse to me. Unfortunately velkopopovicy kozel’s dunkel gave me high expectations for their pilsener which were shot to the ground by how overly malty this beer is.
